jobTitle: Senior Veterinary Nurse Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50398615.txt	§Senior Veterinary Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Veterinary Nurse§§Advertiser: §Carevets Business Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Exciting opportunities have arisen for experienced Veterinary Nurses to join our fantastic teams!§ § §Competitive remuneration§ §A real focus on personal development – grow your career with us§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture – join the CareVets family§ § §  §About the Roles§  §As an experienced Veterinary Nurse, you already have a pretty good idea as to the day-to-day requirements of being a great member of the dynamic nursing team behind any great clinic.  Here are just a few of the key responsibilities that you will be contributing to together with the rest of our team:§ § §Hand-on surgical & diagnostic assistance§ §Patient monitoring & treatment§ §Heading up a team of nurses§ §We currently have vacancies at our Porirua and Kilbirnie clinics which are for full-time roles.  We are always on the lookout for great talent however so feel free to get in touch to talk about possible options.§  § §  §About You§ § §Genuinely care for pets, your colleagues and our clients§ §Work well both in a team and independently§ §High level of integrity and are interested in continued development§ §Good communicator§ §Minimum 2 years experience as a practicing Veterinary Nurse§ §Leadership experience preferred§ §What’s on Offer?§ § §Generous remuneration§ - commensurate with experience and role type§ §Strong focus on personal development§ with an ongoing focus on your career interests§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture§ – become a member of the CareVets family§ §Fantastic location§ §Work-Life balance is important to us§, so rosters are geared with this in mind§ §Dynamic & supportive clinic team§ along with a responsive leadership team§ §Access to a wide network§ of like-minded colleagues across the North Island (and the opportunities that come with such a network)§ § §  §To express your interest in this role ‘apply now’ via SEEK with your CV and cover letter attached.  Any applicants shortlisted will be contacted directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§

jobText: TXT/50413621.txt	§Part-Time Veterinary Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-Time Veterinary Nurse§§Advertiser: §Carevets Business Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Looking for an exciting and challenging new role in emergency and after-hours nursing?!§ §At Waikato After Hours Veterinary Hospital, we work nights, weekends and public holidays and strive to offer the best medicine and care possible for our patients and clients regardless of the time of the day.§ §We are a fun, passionate, welcoming and supportive bunch of vets and nurses and work very well as a team.  We provide after-hours services for all the primary clinics in Hamilton and surrounding areas.  We are looking for a friendly and dedicated vet nurse with a minimum of two years’ experience to join us who is keen to extend their knowledge and take that next exciting step in their career!§ §We are after a part-timer for weekend and public holiday work.  This position might be suitable for someone that is in a primary clinic during the week and wants to have a go at emergency nursing, or someone that is after a foot in the door to potentially become a full-timer down the track.  Maybe you have been on maternity leave or home with children and would like to get back into the industry part-time in an exciting and rewarding role.§ §Your responsibilities will include:§ § §client relations§ §patient evaluation and triage§ §care and monitoring of hospitalised patients and critical transfers§ §taking bloods and placing IV catheters§ §anaesthetic monitoring of high-risk patients§ §digital radiography, CT scans and lab testing§ §fluid therapy and blood transfusion monitoring§ §We have an onsite full IDEXX laboratory and blood gas capabilities, smart flow inpatient hospital system, digital radiography, ultrasound, CT, oscillometric blood pressure, doppler, capnography, ECG, endoscopy, fluid therapy and more.  We also have access to an Emergency and Critical Care Specialist who provides in-house tutorials on various relevant topics.§ §You will be able to work well in a fast-paced environment and must be:§ § §self-motivated and good at multi-tasking§ §able to communicate effectively with clients and staff§ §a good team player and willing to work extra hours if needed§ §enthusiastic and compassionate§ §skilled at using computers and being familiar with Vetlink software would be an advantage§ §a qualified veterinary nurse with at least 2 years experience§ §applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§ §Experience in emergency nursing would be beneficial but not essential.  Full training on our emergency protocols will be provided.§ §We provide a competitive remuneration commensurate with experience and advancement in the practice, continuing education, new skills and learning opportunities on every shift, and you get to use your skills each day you work!§ §Applications for this position will remain open until we find a great match for the team.  If you are interested but are not keen to commit to regular shifts, we are always on the lookout for locum nurses.§ §To express your interest in this role ‘apply now’ via SEEK with your CV and cover letter attached.  Any applicants shortlisted will be contacted directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§

2-3 shifts a week. § §The remuneration is attractive and there is also a bonus system in place.  The team culture is supportive, dedicated and enthusiastic.§ §Applicants must have a current New Zealand Practicing certificate and Work Visa to apply and position start date is as soon as possible.§ §If you have any questions or wish to express an interest, please email §clinicmanager@wavh.co.nz§ §Check us out on www.wavh.co.nz  or our facebook page.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50524700.txt	§Head of NZ Crop Testing & Operations§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head of NZ Crop Testing & Operations§§Advertiser: §OCG Consulting Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Head of NZ Crop Testing & Operations §    §    §      §        §Leadership opportunity within crop research and development § §        §Based in Pukekohe - the heart of Auckland's 'food bowl' § §        §Competitive remuneration package on offer - Apply Today! § §      §      §        §The Bayer Crop Science vegetable seed business serves open-field and protected culture customers through its brands Seminis® and De Ruiter™. Their mission is to deliver products that provide yield and value to their customers, and more tasty and healthy vegetables to the consumer.§        § §        §There currently exists an opportunity to join their Vegetable R&D Division, as Head of their NZ Testing and Operations. This is an exciting role that will see you, leading a small team, testing crops under development and managing operations at their Pukekohe Station. This facility is currently focused on the development and testing of Onion hybrids.§        § §        §The Pukekohe Station was recently developed and is well set up with excellent infrastructure and equipment on site, it is also the base for the Commercial Operations teams giving you exposure to the broader business, as well interfacing with numerous local growers.§        § §        §You'll ideally have come from the commercial growing industry, ideally with onions experience but we'll also consider applicants with experience in other crops. The role is a blend of R&D and Operations with more of a slant to operations so you'll need to be able to demonstrate the practical and operational skills to grow onions and/or other crops. You'll need to be familiar with industry best practices including land preparation, planting and harvesting, and also be familiar with the use and maintenance of all associated equipment.§        § §        §You'll thrive on working in a fast paced and dynamic team environment, developing plans for and juggling multiple projects and also be comfortable analysing and interpreting data. As part of a global business you'll also get the opportunity to work closely with other crop breeding teams, crop strategy leads and the Regional Head of R&D to develop strategy and track metrics for collaborative breeding in vegetable crops. §        § §        §Also, as part of the broader operations leadership responsibilities you will ensure that the research station remains compliant with all Bayer and National HSE, QMS, regulatory and compliance requirements.§        § §        §To be considered for this opportunity you will ideally have:§        § §        §          §            §A tertiary qualification in horticulture§          §          §            §Demonstrable experience in horticulture operations§          §          §            §Experience with onions or similar large scale open-field growing§          §          §            §Proven leadership experience§          §          §            §Excellent communication skills and collaborative working style §          §        §        § §        §This is an amazing opportunity to join an industry leader and take your career to the next level! If you would like to discuss this role in more detail please apply online or call Mark Charles on 021 722 879§        § §        § §        § §        § §        § §        § §      §      §Please quote Ref no:§MCE68259SKW §        §      §    §    §  §§§The Bayer Crop Science vegetable seed business serves open-field and protected culture customers through its brands Seminis® and De Ruiter™. Their mission is to deliver products that provide yield and value to their customers, and more tasty and healthy vegetables to the consumer.§ §There currently exists an opportunity to join their Vegetable R&D Division, as Head of their NZ Testing and Operations. This is an exciting role that will see you, leading a small team, testing crops under development and managing operations at their Pukekohe Station. This facility is currently focused on the development and testing of Onion hybrids.§ §The Pukekohe Station was recently developed and is well set up with excellent infrastructure and equipment on site, it is also the base for the Commercial Operations teams giving you exposure to the broader business, as well interfacing with numerous local growers.§ §You'll ideally have come from the commercial growing industry, ideally with onions experience but we'll also consider applicants with experience in other crops. The role is a blend of R&D and Operations with more of a slant to operations so you'll need to be able to demonstrate the practical and operational skills to grow onions and/or other crops. You'll need to be familiar with industry best practices including land preparation, planting and harvesting, and also be familiar with the use and maintenance of all associated equipment.§ §You'll thrive on working in a fast paced and dynamic team environment, developing plans for and juggling multiple projects and also be comfortable analysing and interpreting data. As part of a global business you'll also get the opportunity to work closely with other crop breeding teams, crop strategy leads and the Regional Head of R&D to develop strategy and track metrics for collaborative breeding in vegetable crops. § §Also, as part of the broader operations leadership responsibilities you will ensure that the research station remains compliant with all Bayer and National HSE, QMS, regulatory and compliance requirements.§ §To be considered for this opportunity you will ideally have:§ §§A tertiary qualification in horticulture§§Demonstrable experience in horticulture operations§§Experience with onions or similar large scale open-field growing§§Proven leadership experience§§Excellent communication skills and collaborative working style §§ §This is an amazing opportunity to join an industry leader and take your career to the next level! If you would like to discuss this role in more detail please apply online or call Mark Charles on 021 722 879§ § § § § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50525749.txt	§Agronomist / Field Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Agronomist / Field Representative§§Advertiser: §Townsend Seeds International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§About the business§ § §Townsend Seeds International Ltd is a New Zealand owned and operated Seed Production Company based at Lincoln with a Production Office and Store in Rakaia.§ §We are 24 Years old with a strong reputation for honesty and integrity within the Seed Farming industry.§ §We have a strong presence and knowledge of the International Seed Industry and we currently supply clients in over 30 countries worldwide.§ §Seed is the beginning of the food chain. It is a dynamic and exciting industry.§ § §About the role§ § §We are seeking to employ an experienced Agronomist / Field Representative to service our farmer client base.§ §Your role involves keeping in close contact with our growers, contracting crop with them, advising and assisting with the growing of the crops from sowing to harvesting and cleaning.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Townsend Seeds is a TEAM orientated Company that prides itself in providing an enjoyable and rewarding work environment and where effort is recognized with earnings.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §You will take over some existing grower clients and build on these to reach and optimum farmer base of at least 100 who you will call on and integrate with them on a regular basis. You will liaise closely with the company traders and keep in close contact with seed cleaning operators and all industry players.§ §You should be an experienced Seed Company Representative / Agronomist with a proven track record and knowledge of both Vegetable and Field crops.§ §The successful applicant will have NZ citizenship and needs to be located within or close to the major seed production areas of the Canterbury Plains.§ §You will require a Full Drivers License and a good Knowledge of computer literacy.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

§Horticulture§§§§§§We are seeking a supervisor/tractor operator to join our team on a fulltime-permanent basis.§Our client is a longstanding producer of Kiwifruit in the Tasman region and is seeking an enthusiastic supervisor/ tractor operator to support their 21-hectare kiwifruit orchard situated in Takaka, New Zealand. §The ideal candidate will have a passion for growing and the outdoors, be able to think on their feet, have experience in supervising picking and pruning teams, and wishes to further their career in the South Island’s horticulture industry.§The key function of this role is to supervise staff during the critical times of the year as well as safely perform all tractor operations including spraying, fertiliser application, forklifting, mowing, mulching, sweeping, bin placement and removal.§The key interactions of this role will be with the orchard manager, permanent production staff, RSE’s, and casual contract workers.§The suitable candidate will:§Be a New Zealand citizen/ permanent resident or have an Open Work Visa.§Demonstrate physical fitness.§Hold a current NZ driver’s license.§Have reliable transport.§Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.§Show competency and experience in machinery operation.§Show experience in the supervision of seasonal horticultural staff.§Be able to work alongside a range of people from various walks of life.§Preferably have a growsafe certificate, however, this is not mandatory.§Preferably have a forklift license, however, this is not mandatory.§Be able to work unsupervised as well as a part of a team.§Be able to work extended hours and weekends when required.§Be willing to comply with health and safety policies.§Have a high standard of workmanship and pride in your work.§This is a fulltime permanent position that requires you to work outdoors and take part in all orchard operations, so being prepared to work in whatever weather Golden Bay throws at you is a plus.§Remuneration will be to a car?§§§

jobTitle: Assistant Orchard Manager Job in Waikato - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50525872.txt	§Assistant Orchard Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Orchard Manager§§Advertiser: §Blueberry Country Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Blueberry Country is a family owned business based in Ohaupo in the Waikato. We have established Orchards in Ohaupo, Ngatea, and Otautau (Southland) and have an orchard under development in Waipu (Northland). We are New Zealand’s Largest holder of Blueberry land with 560 acres (230 hectares) currently in production.                        § §Our head office and main packing facilities are located just 20 minutes south of Hamilton, and the blueberries are grown, harvested, frozen and packed all on site. We also run Pick Your Own (PYO) and café operations through the summer across all our existing orchards.§ §The Role:§ §As a result of our on-going and projected growth, we have a newly created role for a full time Senior Orchard Worker.  This exciting opportunity will suit either an experienced orchard worker or a person that is able to show they are reliable, motivated, quick to learn and enthusiastic to work in the horticultural industry. This hands-on position will be solely based at our Ngatea orchard and reports to the Orchard Manager - Ngatea.                             § §Initially you will be introduced to basic day to day seasonal tasks within the blueberry orchard expanding to develop skills and experience, but not limited to,§ §• Customer service§• Weed control§• Planting§• Pruning§• Spraying§• Pest control§• Mowing§• Fertilizer§• Machinery maintenance & operation§ §Responsibilities:§ §• Visitor and staff safety§• Crop health§• Harvest quality§• Assisting orchard manager with property and asset security§• During orchard managers absence, ensure timely opening and secure close-down of property and system processes.§ §Further development may be offered to the ambitious applicant involving maintaining accurate administrative records of orchard activities including spray registers, work progress, payroll, health & safety reports and expenditure records combined with expanded management responsibilities.§ §Key Personal Attributes:§ §• Previous orchard experience and/or relevant qualifications.§• NZ drivers’ licence.§• Excellent communication skills and the ability to develop strong working relationships.§• Strong interpersonal skills, ability to multitask and a keen eye for detail.§• Ability to train, supervise and lead staff.§• Willingness to work in all weather conditions.§• Willingness to work flexible hours during the peak seasons (Dec-Mar). §• Basic math & computer skills.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50526166.txt	§Veterinary Receptionist/ Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Receptionist/ Nurse§§Advertiser: §Victory Vets§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§We are a friendly locally owned companion animal veterinary clinic in Nelson looking for a capable and enthusiastic veterinary receptionist to join our team. There is potential for this to be combined with a veterinary nursing role for the right person. § §We want to help our client’s pets live their best life. This is the reason we come to work. Alongside that we have a great team culture, have fun at work and like to embrace all that Nelson has to offer.§ §We are looking for someone energetic and outgoing with a positive can-do attitude who is passionate about pets. You will need to be able to deliver excellent customer service to our clients, be able to multi-task in an ever-evolving environment, remain calm under pressure, and be detail orientated.§ §The role is mainly client-focused, managing appointments and client communication, and also involves stock management, retail sales, and data entry.  A high level of written and oral communication skills are required, as well as a sound computing background.§ §The successful candidate would ideally have prior experience working within the veterinary industry, however all applicants with relevant skills will be considered.§ §We are looking for someone reliable, flexible with work hours and with the ability to work weekends.§ §The Victory Vets team is made up of 8 vets and 16 support staff, and we are open 7 days offering a large array of surgical and medical services.§ §If you are interested in joining the Victory Vets team and think you fit the description above, please get in touch, making sure you include a cover letter with your C.V.§ §Email: §vicvetsnelson@outlook.co.nz§Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50527015.txt	§Outdoor Vegetable Production Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outdoor Vegetable Production Assistant§§Advertiser: §Oakley's Premium Fresh Vegetables§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Rest of Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Oakley’s Premium Fresh Vegetables is a family business dedicated to growing, harvesting, packing and delivering the freshest of produce throughout New Zealand. With complete control of the production process, we can assure traceability, food safety and complete quality assurance. Our company has grown from the desire to always have the best quality and the most consistent supply of product. §We are currently seeking a §full-time permanent Outdoor Vegetable Production Assistant§ to work in our Production Team, based at our main operation located in Southbridge. Please note, §Southbridge is located 50km from Christchurch city.§ This is a role to support the production team in order to achieve the expected goals in every crop. The individual will be responsible for doing groundwork when required, help during potato crop planting, beetroot and pumpkin drilling, do tasks on broccoli crops, basic maintenance of machinery, spraying if and when required, general duties around the farms. §We are seeking an individual who can display the following attributes:§Qualification in Agriculture/Horticulture or proven farming experience;§Organisational skills;§Great communication & inter-personal skills; §Great motivation towards producing quality crops and food.§Preferred experience in harvesting, cultivation, planting, spraying and irrigation;§Adaptability to changes on a busy environment;§Ability to go the extra mile and get the job done;§Flexible - due to the nature of the industry you must be available to work extended hours and weekends when required.§Have the right to work in New Zealand for §at least the next 12 months §e.g. New Zealand citizen, permanent resident, or valid visa§This is an exciting opportunity for the right individual to join a growing family business. Oakley’s offers ongoing training and development opportunities for the right person. Our employees enjoy working in a friendly, fun and supportive team environment.§Please upload your CV and a cover letter on seek by §22nd September 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50527074.txt	§Business Manager - Plant Production§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Manager - Plant Production§§Advertiser: §Convergence Partners Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Business Manager - Plant Production §      §        §          §Based in Blenheim, Rotorua or possibly Auckland§          §Commercial role within the field of Horticulture§          §Leadership, Strategy, Business Development, Science§        §        § §        §The Company: §        §Our client is a leader in the horticulture and forestry fields with operations around the country; the business is profitable and in growth mode.  This role will ideally be based in Blenheim, however Rotorua or South Auckland could also be possibilities for the right person. §        § §        §The Role:  §        §A newly created role has been established to lead the business in breeding, seed production,  seedling growth and supply – a critical part of the business with opportunity for expansion. §        §This is a unique role that has the perfect blend of leadership, science and commercial elements.  You will lead 3 separate operations in different parts of the country and will need to either understand, or develop an understanding of the science behind the breeding for seed production. §        §With a strong understanding of the technical aspects of the business, you will develop robust business strategies to build volume, revenue and profit.  There are domestic growth opportunities to capitalise on and potential to explore commercial and operational opportunities in Australia.   §        § §        §The ideal person:§        §Leading a small, highly skilled and experienced team, you will be a strong leader who has the ability to engage the hearts and minds of the talented individuals in your team.  You will be able to clearly demonstrate how you have led diverse teams in previous roles and how your approach in engaging people has helped to maintain new standards and keep momentum going.   §        §You will have a mix of technical and commercial elements in your career to date and can show evidence of developing strategies that have resulted in profitable growth in previous businesses. §        §You will likely come from a plant based breeding or horticulture business or possibly a primary sector business where you have gained experience in operations, strategy, transformation, supply chain and logistics.  Ideally you have also worked in the field of biological sciences at some stage in your career or at least have a degree in a relevant field and can demonstrate strong technical and analytical skills to underpin your commercial expertise§        § §        §Summary: §        §This is a senior role that will utilise your commercial acumen and technical expertise in an organisation where there is real opportunity to build profitable growth.  This will suit someone who wants to make things happen and is able to make a real difference.  Have you got what it takes?  Is this the role that will put your career on the map? §        § §        §Please email your CV to Bobbi Ryan at Convergence Partners.  Please ensure you outline both your commercial and your science experience.  §        §bobbi@convergencepartners.co.nz§        § §      §      §      §      §    §    §Convergence Partners is a highly experienced team offering Search & Selection for Permanent Appointments & Executive Contracting roles across the areas of: Finance, Legal & Risk; Technology, Transformation & Change; Sales & Marketing; Supply Chain, Operations & Procurement | §convergencepartners.co.nz§  §§§ §Based in Blenheim, Rotorua or possibly Auckland§ §Commercial role within the field of Horticulture§ §Leadership, Strategy, Business Development, Science§ § § §The Company: § §Our client is a leader in the horticulture and forestry fields with operations around the country; the business is profitable and in growth mode.  This role will ideally be based in Blenheim, however Rotorua or South Auckland could also be possibilities for the right person. § § § §The Role:  § §A newly created role has been established to lead the business in breeding, seed production,  seedling growth and supply – a critical part of the business with opportunity for expansion. § §This is a unique role that has the perfect blend of leadership, science and commercial elements.  You will lead 3 separate operations in different parts of the country and will need to either understand, or develop an understanding of the science behind the breeding for seed production. § §With a strong understanding of the technical aspects of the business, you will develop robust business strategies to build volume, revenue and profit.  There are domestic growth opportunities to capitalise on and potential to explore commercial and operational opportunities in Australia.   § § § §The ideal person:§ §Leading a small, highly skilled and experienced team, you will be a strong leader who has the ability to engage the hearts and minds of the talented individuals in your team.  You will be able to clearly demonstrate how you have led diverse teams in previous roles and how your approach in engaging people has helped to maintain new standards and keep momentum going.   § §You will have a mix of technical and commercial elements in your career to date and can show evidence of developing strategies that have resulted in profitable growth in previous businesses. § §You will likely come from a plant based breeding or horticulture business or possibly a primary sector business where you have gained experience in operations, strategy, transformation, supply chain and logistics.  Ideally you have also worked in the field of biological sciences at some stage in your career or at least have a degree in a relevant field and can demonstrate strong technical and analytical skills to underpin your commercial expertise§ § § §Summary: § §This is a senior role that will utilise your commercial acumen and technical expertise in an organisation where there is real opportunity to build profitable growth.  This will suit someone who wants to make things happen and is able to make a real difference.  Have you got what it takes?  Is this the role that will put your career on the map? § § § §Please email your CV to Bobbi Ryan at Convergence Partners.  Please ensure you outline both your commercial and your science experience.  § §bobbi@convergencepartners.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

§Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Business Manager - Plant Production §      §        §          §Based in Blenheim, Rotorua or possibly Auckland§          §Commercial role within the field of Horticulture§          §Leadership, Strategy, Business Development, Science§        §        § §        §The Company: §        §Our client is a leader in the horticulture and forestry fields with operations around the country; the business is profitable and in growth mode.  This role will ideally be based in Blenheim, however Rotorua or South Auckland could also be possibilities for the right person. §        § §        §The Role:  §        §A newly created role has been established to lead the business in breeding, seed production,  seedling growth and supply – a critical part of the business with opportunity for expansion. §        §This is a unique role that has the perfect blend of leadership, science and commercial elements.  You will lead 3 separate operations in different parts of the country and will need to either understand, or develop an understanding of the science behind the breeding for seed production. §        §With a strong understanding of the technical aspects of the business, you will develop robust business strategies to build volume, revenue and profit.  There are domestic growth opportunities to capitalise on and potential to explore commercial and operational opportunities in Australia.   §        § §        §The ideal person:§        §Leading a small, highly skilled and experienced team, you will be a strong leader who has the ability to engage the hearts and minds of the talented individuals in your team.  You will be able to clearly demonstrate how you have led diverse teams in previous roles and how your approach in engaging people has helped to maintain new standards and keep momentum going.   §        §You will have a mix of technical and commercial elements in your career to date and can show evidence of developing strategies that have resulted in profitable growth in previous businesses. §        §You will likely come from a plant based breeding or horticulture business or possibly a primary sector business where you have gained experience in operations, strategy, transformation, supply chain and logistics.  Ideally you have also worked in the field of biological sciences at some stage in your career or at least have a degree in a relevant field and can demonstrate strong technical and analytical skills to underpin your commercial expertise§        § §        §Summary: §        §This is a senior role that will utilise your commercial acumen and technical expertise in an organisation where there is real opportunity to build profitable growth.  This will suit someone who wants to make things happen and is able to make a real difference.  Have you got what it takes?  Is this the role that will put your career on the map? §        § §        §Please email your CV to Bobbi Ryan at Convergence Partners.  Please ensure you outline both your commercial and your science experience.  §        §bobbi@convergencepartners.co.nz§        § §      §      §      §      §    §    §Convergence Partners is a highly experienced team offering Search & Selection for Permanent Appointments & Executive Contracting roles across the areas of: Finance, Legal & Risk; Technology, Transformation & Change; Sales & Marketing; Supply Chain, Operations & Procurement | §convergencepartners.co.nz§  §§§ §Based in Blenheim, Rotorua or possibly Auckland§ §Commercial role within the field of Horticulture§ §Leadership, Strategy, Business Development, Science§ § § §The Company: § §Our client is a leader in the horticulture and forestry fields with operations around the country; the business is profitable and in growth mode.  This role will ideally be based in Blenheim, however Rotorua or South Auckland could also be possibilities for the right person. § § § §The Role:  § §A newly created role has been established to lead the business in breeding, seed production,  seedling growth and supply – a critical part of the business with opportunity for expansion. § §This is a unique role that has the perfect blend of leadership, science and commercial elements.  You will lead 3 separate operations in different parts of the country and will need to either understand, or develop an understanding of the science behind the breeding for seed production. § §With a strong understanding of the technical aspects of the business, you will develop robust business strategies to build volume, revenue and profit.  There are domestic growth opportunities to capitalise on and potential to explore commercial and operational opportunities in Australia.   § § § §The ideal person:§ §Leading a small, highly skilled and experienced team, you will be a strong leader who has the ability to engage the hearts and minds of the talented individuals in your team.  You will be able to clearly demonstrate how you have led diverse teams in previous roles and how your approach in engaging people has helped to maintain new standards and keep momentum going.   § §You will have a mix of technical and commercial elements in your career to date and can show evidence of developing strategies that have resulted in profitable growth in previous businesses. § §You will likely come from a plant based breeding or horticulture business or possibly a primary sector business where you have gained experience in operations, strategy, transformation, supply chain and logistics.  Ideally you have also worked in the field of biological sciences at some stage in your career or at least have a degree in a relevant field and can demonstrate strong technical and analytical skills to underpin your commercial expertise§ § § §Summary: § §This is a senior role that will utilise your commercial acumen and technical expertise in an organisation where there is real opportunity to build profitable growth.  This will suit someone who wants to make things happen and is able to make a real difference.  Have you got what it takes?  Is this the role that will put your career on the map? § § § §Please email your CV to Bobbi Ryan at Convergence Partners.  Please ensure you outline both your commercial and your science experience.  § §bobbi@convergencepartners.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50529712.txt	§Supervisor, (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supervisor, (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Rest of Southland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Supervisor, (Fixed Term) §        §          §Are you a natural organiser who loves working with others and coordinating teams and large work programs? Are you looking for an interesting new challenge that offers the chance to contribute to conservation and the protection of New Zealand's unique natural environment?§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role §          §This is a 12 month fixed term role where we are piloting a second Supervisor in the Te Anau Biodiversity Team.§          §The Supervisor Biodiversity is a unique and exciting role that forms part of the Te Anau district leadership team.  It is responsible for the leadership and delivery of the biodiversity work program for Te Anau and surrounding areas within our District. §          §You will supervise and manage a team of up to 7 staff, planning and supporting their work program and enabling them to operate at their best every day. Your other focus will be contract management for the Te Anau biodiversity team.§          §A major component of your work will be enabling your team to develop and succeed in their own work. In this Supervisor position, you need to have an eye for detail, a willingness to work towards continuous improvement, and plenty of drive and initiative. Health, safety and the wellbeing of your staff is a high priority.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for §          §We're looking for a real people person who is a positive, outgoing personality, someone who enjoys working within a close-knit high performing team.  Your ability to think strategically and act operationally will contribute to the successful planning and delivery of work programs across the district and includes a natural ability to switch between tasks effortlessly.§          §There can be times when the workload will be high so you will need to be able to remain calm and focused and work well under pressure, you will be confident interacting with people from all walks of life.  Having an understanding of the iwi partners in the district, te reo, and tikanga Māori, could be advantageous to building those relationships to integrate amongst the local communities to understand their values with our work.§          §Key Skills§:§          §            §Great communication skills and the ability to get on with a wide range of people§          §          §            §Contract management§            §Excellent planning and organisational skills, with attention to detail§            §Strong leadership with a focus on development and empowerment of your team§            §Ability to adapt to changing circumstances when organising field programs§            §Physically fit§            §Good backcountry skills and knowledge§            §Self-aware and agile to adapt as the role requirements evolve§            §Strong health and safety focus§            §A current full driving licence§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §Along with recently being awarded New Zealand's second most attractive employer (first in the public service!) people like working for us because we offer:§          §            §Competitive remuneration§            §A supportive and collaborative work environment§            §Respect, recognition and opportunities for personal growth§            §Excellent employee wellbeing initiatives including the employee assistance program and discounted insurance§            §Free accommodation in our backcountry huts and campsites as well as general travel and accommodation discounts§            §Job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work§          §          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §When demonstrating how you meet the requirements and capabilities. For tips on how to complete your CV please refer to the following link: §https://www.doc.govt.nz/careers/how-to-get-a-job-at-doc/recruitment-process/how-to-write-a-cv-and-cover-letter/§          §For more information please contact Tony Preston, §tpreston@doc.govt.nz§, §0273427665§, §quoting reference: T 00/8370/3§          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 14 September 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Are you a natural organiser who loves working with others and coordinating teams and large work programs? Are you looking for an interesting new challenge that offers the chance to contribute to conservation and the protection of New Zealand's unique natural environment?§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role §This is a 12 month fixed term role where we are piloting a second Supervisor in the Te Anau Biodiversity Team.§The Supervisor Biodiversity is a unique and exciting role that forms part of the Te Anau district leadership team.  It is responsible for the leadership and delivery of the biodiversity work program for Te Anau and surrounding areas within our District. §You will supervise and manage a team of up to 7 staff, planning and supporting their work program and enabling them to operate at their best every day. Your other focus will be contract management for the Te Anau biodiversity team.§A major component of your work will be enabling your team to develop and succeed in their own work. In this Supervisor position, you need to have an eye for detail, a willingness to work towards continuous improvement, and plenty of drive and initiative. Health, safety and the wellbeing of your staff is a high priority.§ §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for §We're looking for a real people person who is a positive, outgoing personality, someone who enjoys working within a close-knit high performing team.  Your ability to think strategically and act operationally will contribute to the successful planning and delivery of work programs across the district and includes a natural ability to switch between tasks effortlessly.§There can be times when the workload will be high so you will need to be able to remain calm and focused and work well under pressure, you will be confident interacting with people from all walks of life.  Having an understanding of the iwi partners in the district, te reo, and tikanga Māori, could be advantageous to building those relationships to integrate amongst the local communities to understand their values with our work.§Key Skills§:§§Great communication skills and the ability to get on with a wide range of people§§Contract management§Excellent planning and organisational skills, with attention to detail§Strong leadership with a focus on development and empowerment of your team§Ability to adapt to changing circumstances when organising field programs§Physically fit§Good backcountry skills and knowledge§Self-aware and agile to adapt as the role requirements evolve§Strong health and safety focus§A current full driving licence§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§Along with recently being awarded New Zealand's second most attractive employer (first in the public service!) people like working for us because we offer:§§Competitive remuneration§A supportive and collaborative work environment§Respect, recognition and opportunities for personal growth§Excellent employee wellbeing initiatives including the employee assistance program and discounted insurance§Free accommodation in our backcountry huts and campsites as well as general travel and accommodation discounts§Job satisfaction from contributing to crucial and meaningful work§§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §When demonstrating how you meet the requirements and capabilities. For tips on how to complete your CV please refer to the following link: §https://www.doc.govt.nz/careers/how-to-get-a-job-at-doc/recruitment-process/how-to-write-a-cv-and-cover-letter/§For more information please contact Tony Preston, §tpreston@doc.govt.nz§, §0273427665§, §quoting reference: T 00/8370/3§§Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 14 September 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. jobText: TXT/50531243.txt	§Extraction staff§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Extraction staff§§Advertiser: §Spring Bank Honey§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §North Canterbury§§Salary§§$19.50 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§We are located just out of Cust, which is around 10 minutes out of Rangiora (35 minutes out of Christchurch).§We are looking for a hardworking and energetic person to join our honey extraction and shed team. We have a great work environment and work in some beautiful areas of New Zealand. The average hours of the job are 40-45 hours per week, with possible longer hours in the peak season and we may work some weekends in the peak season. The role will primarily be extracting frames of honey, as well as some general shed work.  This is a seasonal position starting from August 2020. §This position requires no experience and there will be full training given.§If proven successful you will be hired on a casual basis for the first 3 Months.§Looking for people to be able to start in August.§All applicants must:§• Be self-motivated team players and keen to learn§• Be reliable and able to work at a reasonable speed§• Be physically fit and healthy§• Have excellent communication skills, and the ability to follow instructions easily and accurately§· Have a current drivers licence and a reliable form of transport.§If this sounds like you, apply now!§Applicants for this position are required to have an CURRENT NZ WORK VISA or to be an New Zealand resident.§Applicants will be asked to provide contact details for at least 2 references from past employees.§If you are interested in the position, please contact Paige or Emma with your CV at §applications@springbankhoney.com§.§We will contact you if your application is successful.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.  §§§§

This is a full-time role, Monday to Friday, with fairly rostered late nights and after hours.§ § § §About the Role§ §Here are the key responsibilities of this role:§ §·         Vet nursing in consultations and surgery§ §·         Inventory ordering and stock control§ §·         Data entry and maintenance of patient files§ §·         Planning and participating in seasonal farm work§ §·         Effective communication with Vets, Technicians and Clinic staff§ §·         Managing the customer service function including taking farm and companion animal bookings§ §·         Participate in the Vet Nurse on call, and weekend roster at our Rotorua Animal Hospital.§ § § §About You§ §·         You have strong computer skills and you are an excellent communicator (experience with VetLink practice management software preferable)§ §·         You have 2+ years post qualification experience as a Veterinary Technologist or Vet Nurse with a relevant qualification§ §·         You are keen to expand your knowledge and continue your development§ §·         You are driven to help grow our expanding Ngongotahā business§ § § §What’s on Offer?§ §•    An attractive remuneration package based on experience§ §•    Medical and Surgical Health Insurance and Life Insurance§ §•    Generous staff discounts§ §•    Company funded NZVNA membership§ §•    A fantastic location with an abundance of world-renowned recreational pursuits§ § § §If you have a strong work ethic, a solution focused outlook and a great deal of wit, we look forward to receiving your application.§ § § §For general enquiries, email Mickey van der Merwe, People Manager – §mickey.vandermerwe@vetora.nz§.§ § § §Applications close on the 30th of September 2020.§ § § §Only applicants who have the right to work in New Zealand permanently need apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

Viticulture§§§§§§Whitehaven Wine Company is a leading New Zealand family-owned wine company producing an award-winning collection of 100% Marlborough wines with an uncompromising focus on quality.  Our broad portfolio of wines are sustainably produced from our own accredited sustainable winery where we are committed to improving all aspects of our social and environmental integrity.§  §A varied and interesting role exists for a machinery operator based at our Boundary Bay vineyard in the Dillons Point area. §  §Reporting to the Vineyard Manager and working with other Whitehaven staff, this role is hands-on, varied and often with just the radio for company.  The successful applicant will be primarily responsible for executing a range of tractor work, irrigation and trellis maintenance, ground keeping and general assistance as requested. §  §Whitehaven’s company culture is based on the values of §Respect, Innovation §and §Collaboration§.  Therefore the successful applicant will have by mutual agreement.  Previous vineyard experience is preferred, while any outstanding certificates/licenses and further mechanical training can be sought for the right applicant.§  §A written You do not need any previous experience or skills in horticulture, as onsite training is provided.§We want to upskill you, to enable you to progress your career in horticulture. jobText: TXT/50536284.txt	§Vineyard Labour Co-ordinator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vineyard Labour Co-ordinator §§Advertiser: §Edge Viticulture§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§Edge Viticulture is a locally owned and operated vineyard management and contracting business. We are currently seeking a full-time permanent employee to assist with our increasing work-load. This is a senior supervision position, based in the Renwick area and we operate on various vineyards across the Wairau and Awatere valleys.§You will ideally have previous experience with training and supervising vineyard staff. The work-load will be varied and the successful applicant will need to be able to work independently and think on their feet, problem solving as they go. §Key parts of the role during the Summer period, involve working with external labour providers to schedule work and ensure that it is completed to a high standard. You will also assist with machinery operation during peak periods and be responsible for irrigation monitoring and maintenance. §During the Winter months direct supervision and training of our own RSE and local pruners is required. §In down-times you will help out as required in other aspects of the business, such as machinery operation and hands-on vineyard tasks and maintenance. §The successful applicant must have:§- Full drivers licence§- Minimum 5 years vineyard experience§- Ability to work independently and self-manage§- Excellent communication skills§- Ability to work flexible hours with early starts at peak periods§- Proven ability to keep accurate records§- Be physically fit and be able to work outdoors all year round§- Must be able to pass a drug test§Preference will be given to applicants with:§- Experience with Vinea software§- Tractor and machinery operation experience §- Current First Aid and Growsafe Certificates§The remuneration package will reflect the experience and capability of the successful candidate. Necessary training will be provided to the successful applicant. §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§Criminal convictions must be disclosed during the application process§Please apply with C.V. and references to §admin@edgeviticulture.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50541511.txt	§Inventory and Fruit Quality Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inventory and Fruit Quality Manager§§Advertiser: §Apata Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Inventory and Fruit Quality Manager §      §        §Apata Group Limited is a dynamic Kiwifruit and Avocado post-harvest operator in New Zealand's horticultural centre: the Bay of Plenty.  §        §Apata is positioned as an industry leader in inventory management and quality assurance and we understand that excellence in these critical aspects is paramount to the continued success of our business. The Inventory and Fruit Quality Manager is a crucial senior management role within the company’s Operations division. Your primary responsibility will be to apply your already extensive knowledge and experience of kiwifruit fruit physiology and quality to continuously improve Apata's systems and processes with regard to inventory and coolstore management.§        §The ideal candidate will have:§        §          §High level knowledge and understanding of kiwifruit fruit physiology and fruit quality either in a pre-harvest or post-harvest environment. Experience in both is highly desirable.§          §Systems and process focused with a high degree of computational and numeracy skills.§          §The ability to make prompt and clear decisions and take actions that could involve choices or considered risks§          §A passion for analysing and interpreting data§          §Experience in leading and supervising. §          §Management experience within the kiwifruit industry is highly desirable§          §Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to focus on deadlines§          §Strong commitment to providing excellent client service for external and internal clients§        §        §Apata offers:§        §          §A fantastic team environment§          §Opportunity to develop and progress for those with drive and potential§          §On-site parking§          §Training§          §Attractive remuneration package for the right candidate, including a competitive salary, phone and laptop.§        §        §This is an excellent opportunity to develop your career within an expanding and highly regarded post-harvest facility.  The role can be based at either of our sites in Te Puke or Katikati.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Apata Group Limited is a dynamic Kiwifruit and Avocado post-harvest operator in New Zealand's horticultural centre: the Bay of Plenty.  §  §Apata is positioned as an industry leader in inventory management and quality assurance and we understand that excellence in these critical aspects is paramount to the continued success of our business. The Inventory and Fruit Quality Manager is a crucial senior management role within the company’s Operations division. Your primary responsibility will be to apply your already extensive knowledge and experience of kiwifruit fruit physiology and quality to continuously improve Apata's systems and processes with regard to inventory and coolstore management.§  §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §High level knowledge and understanding of kiwifruit fruit physiology and fruit quality either in a pre-harvest or post-harvest environment. Experience in both is highly desirable.§ §Systems and process focused with a high degree of computational and numeracy skills.§ §The ability to make prompt and clear decisions and take actions that could involve choices or considered risks§ §A passion for analysing and interpreting data§ §Experience in leading and supervising. § §Management experience within the kiwifruit industry is highly desirable§ §Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to focus on deadlines§ §Strong commitment to providing excellent client service for external and internal clients§ §Apata offers:§ § §A fantastic team environment§ §Opportunity to develop and progress for those with drive and potential§ §On-site parking§ §Training§ §Attractive remuneration package for the right candidate, including a competitive salary, phone and laptop.§ §This is an excellent opportunity to develop your career within an expanding and highly regarded post-harvest facility.  The role can be based at either of our sites in Te Puke or Katikati.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§Have you completed a qualification in horticulture?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50543996.txt	§Emergency & Critical Care Veterinary Nurse§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Emergency & Critical Care Veterinary Nurse§§Advertiser: §After Hours Veterinary Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§ §Emergency and Critical Care Veterinary Nurse - PART TIME POSITION § § §A unique opportunity exists for a veterinary nurse to join the team at the Christchurch After Hours Veterinary Centre. We are an emergency veterinary facility servicing over 45 shareholder clinics throughout Christchurch and the Canterbury region and are open nights, weekends and public holidays. We are recruiting for a part time position but we are interested in hearing from veterinary nurses who are looking for full time hours or casual work also. § §You will be doing all usual nursing duties including patient triage and nursing consults, placing IV catheters, venipuncture, taking radiographs, surgical nursing and anaesthetic monitoring. You will be an empathetic person who is confident, enthusiastic, willing to learn and engaged. The ability to multitask and work well under pressure in an environment where emotions can run high is essential. The hours on offer are predominantly weekends and public holidays. § §Essential skills and attributes: § § § §Availability to work nights, weekends and public holidays. § § § §Consistently demonstrate high quality patient care. § § § §Willingness to assist with short-notice shift cover, from time to time, if required. § § § §2 years clinical experience preferred.§ § §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. § §Pay is commensurate with experience and qualifications. We are offering excellent remuneration to the ideal candidate, along with the opportunity to acquire new and diverse skills. If you would like to become part of the dynamic AHVC team please email your application, including a cover letter and resume, outlining your suitability against the above mentioned criteria to: § §headnurse@afterhoursvet.co.nz§  § §After Hours Veterinary Centre § §90 Disraeli St , Christchurch § §Applications close 27 Mar 2020.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobTitle: 2021 Vintage Cellarhands - Hawkes Bay Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50546760.txt	§2021 Vintage Cellarhands - Hawkes Bay§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§2021 Vintage Cellarhands - Hawkes Bay§§Advertiser: §Villa Maria Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§ Villa Maria is 100% family-owned and is New Zealand’s Most Awarded winery. For the last four consecutive years Villa Maria has been named in the top ten most admired wine brands in the world and number one in New Zealand by Drinks International. At Villa Maria we are as passionate about our people as we are about producing quality wine.§Villa Maria Family of Wineries has a new state-of-the-art winery located in the North Island in the Gimblett Gravels of Hawkes Bay, a multifaceted grape growing region with a reputation for world class Chardonnay, Syrah and Bordeaux Blends in addition to our suite of aromatic white varietals. The winery is home to our iconic brands §Villa Maria, Vidal Estate, Esk Valley and Leftfield §and presents a unique and engaging opportunity to work with some of New Zealand’s most renowned winemakers, all under one roof. Our Hawke’s Bay winery is designed to accommodate a range of wine styles and has a particular focus on our significant barrel program.§We are now seeking §Harvest Cellarhands §and §Harvest Team Leaders§ to join us in §Hawkes Bay §for the §2021 Harvest §season.  So, we need experienced and inexperienced people to join our team as we have different levels of Cellarhand roles to offer.§What we need from you:§  §Share our culture of Health & Safety first and be eager to learn our processes and procedures.§  §Be physically fit and have a positive attitude with a hands-on approach.§  §Be self-motivated and energetic with a great work ethic.§  §The ability to multitask and work well under pressure while having a strong attention to detail.§  §Forklift competency will be highly valued.§What we will offer you:§  §A competitive remuneration rate.§  §A daily shift meal.§  §Relevant training depending on the experience you bring.§  §A safe and supportive work environment§Vintage Cellarhand - Level C (no experience needed)§If you come with a willingness to learn and have an optimistic, can do attitude and enjoy physical work will be offered a full induction and training program for their role.   Previous experience with grape receival, pressing, crushing, barrel work, wine/juice transfer and racking and clarification processes will be a distinct advantage however not essential as we will provide training to ensure you are ready for Harvest.§Vintage Cellarhand - Level B (experience required)§Our experienced Cellarhands assume Team Leader responsibilities during Harvest.   For these roles, you will need to have excellent communication skills as you will work closely with our Cellar Supervisors and will be assist with the training, leading and managing small teams of people during Harvest. You must have the ability to competently undertake several tasks at once while also having a strong attention to detail. Previous experience in the winery and a high level of proficiency with most cellar operations are essential. Health and Safety will be your priority while ensuring all operations are completed efficiently and to the highest standard.  §If you want to have the opportunity to work with our highly dedicated team of passionate people and make fantastic wines, we would love to hear from you!§We are offering fixed term work for our 2021 harvest period and will be between February to May 2021.  Shift work will be required and during the peak of harvest working up to 10 hour shifts across 6 days. §Only people who are physically residing and are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence of a Work Visa or Residency will be required. §Don't miss out on an opportunity to join our 2021 vintage team.  Apply now. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Vintage-Cellarhand-Level-B-2021.pdf§,§Vintage-Cellarhand-2021.pdf§§§§

jobText: TXT/50546838.txt	§Grower Liaison §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Grower Liaison §§Advertiser: §Yealands§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§In 2008, a wild and rugged stretch of coastline on the north-eastern tip of New Zealand’s South Island became home to one of the most sustainable wineries in the world. §In just 12 years, Yealands has grown to be one of NZ’s most recognised wine labels with an award winning reputation.§The Opportunity §We have an exciting opportunity for a Grower Liaison to manage and develop new and existing grower relationships in the Marlborough region.  You will be the face of Yealands to our grower network, nurturing relationships that are critical to our grape supply. We are looking for someone with exceptional interpersonal and client relationship skills as well as a deep passion for the industry. §Reporting to the Technical Viticulturist, your role will include;§ §  §Managing & ensuring adherence to all grower contracts §  §Negotiating grower contracts to align with wine sales forecast§  §Building strong relationships with our growers to foster innovative ways of working      §  §Monitoring grower crops for quality and volume§  §Providing technical advice to growers§  §Supporting and advising growers to assist them in meeting and maintaining compliance requirements§  §Actively engaging with our sustainability initiatives §Although industry experience is not a must, you will have a technical mind and have experience working in a client facing role in the agricultural or horticultural space. §Are you the right person for us?§  §Attitude is important – being a positive, team player, with a sense of humour §  §You will have a keen interest in sustainability & the wine industry§  §You will have excellent time management and organisational skills with the ability to work to multiple deadlines§  §With strong initiative you will be self-motivated and work well under pressure§  §You must have the ability to work flexible hours over vintage and hold a current NZ Drivers Licence §What’s in it for you? §  §A professional team with strong ethics§  §A great location – with an office base in the heart of our Seaview Vineyard§  §Great salary, health insurance and wine allowance§  §A day off on your birthday! §  §2 weeks paid parental/partners leave§Opportunities like this don’t come around often. You will be working with an experienced team and provided with the support to excel. §If this sounds like you then apply now by submitting your CV & Cover Letter. §Please note, the successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug & alcohol test. §Applications close 2 October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Grower-Liaison.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our aim is to be a long-term producer of high-quality food and forest products whilst managing land sustainably, developing our people and maintaining a balance of growing and diversifying existing investment strategies. Being reasonably new to the Horticulture sector there is where there is an exciting opportunity for growth for you as we look for a highly experienced Orchard Manager.§ §About the role:§Reporting to and working alongside the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for assisting the maximising of production through the safe and effective planning and execution of the orchard developments.  This includes all the day to day requirements from budget planning, harvest and the liaison with contractors and suppliers.  Although based in Hawkes Bay, flexibility is required for some travel to the Gisborne orchard and/or head office in Christchurch.§ §What you bring:§You’ll be an experienced leader (preferably over 10 years) and have a demonstrable work history in the growing of apples. Candidates who have worked with other tree grown fruit will also be considered. Ideally you will have a relevant tertiary qualification coupled with a strong focus on health and safety and compliance and will be well versed in all facets of apple production including irrigation and fertigation. You will be an excellent communicator and possess the ability to liaise with people at all levels and of varying nationalities.  Your financial acumen, adaptive mindset and openness to change ensures that you and the people you lead, have a continuous improvement focus. § §If you’re interested in this position, click ‘apply now’ and forward and up to date cv.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Have you worked in a role where you were responsible for budget management & forecasting?§Are you available to work outside your usual hours when required? (e.g. weekends, evenings, public holidays)§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50555132.txt	§Business Development Manager - Jobloads§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager - Jobloads§§Advertiser: §AgRecruit Human Resources§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Rest of Hawkes Bay§§Salary§§Remuneration  - based on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Jobloads is the newly launched cloud based labour supply solution - designed for the New Zealand primary industry.  It enables employers to scale up their casual and seasonal workforce, accessing reliable, pre-screened jobseekers from around New Zealand. See www.jobloads.co.nz   § §Our vision is to help workplaces thrive - by enabling a future where every employee's placement and work experience is tika - right.§ §As seen in The Orchardist, National Business Review, Sunday Star Times and Stuff – Jobloads is at the start of an exciting journey to help solve primary industry labour challenges. §Our Gisborne pilot is wrapping up and Jobloads is poised for growth.§ §We are now searching for an experienced Business Development Manager to help us drive the business forward.  You will be either Hawkes Bay or BOP based, travelling as required.§ §In this key role, you will work alongside the CEO to build the employer client base plus develop and deliver a scalable growth strategy. Your focus will be on transitioning growers and post harvest operations to Jobloads’ labour supply platform by driving new customer acquisition and generating a strong sales pipeline for the business.   You will also spend time with industry bodies and other influencers, educating and sharing developments and new product offerings.§ §We are looking for an energetic and passionate professional with the following attributes:§ § §An understanding of seasonality & labour requirements in horticultural or viticultural businesses§ §Experience building strong, senior level business relationships  § §Proven experience developing and implementing sustainable growth strategies§ §A commercial mindset, financial acumen, computer literacy§ §Success with driving customer acquisition in a b2b sales or business development role  § § To inquire about Jobloads and this role in strict confidence, please phone Deb Francis from AgRecruit on 021 224 5000. Otherwise send your expression of interest with cover letter via this platform by Thursday 24 September.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50555481.txt	§Farm Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Farm Manager§§Advertiser: §Align Farms§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§Align Farms prides itself on their innovative approach to dairy farming, their focus on strategies that will secure long term returns and sustainability for the business, and their engagement with the people who ‘make it happen’ every day on farm.§This Farm Manager role is new with a primary focus on the leadership and management of the on farm team, and is supported by the on-site operations manager.§With 1700 cows, two sheds, great housing options and a talented team already in place, the challenge is to maximise farm performance (we’re aiming for top 5%) whilst building a team that loves their work, loves their work place and loves what the business is, and can do, for them.§With a mix of nationalities in the predominantly migrant team, it goes without saying that you’ll already have great leadership experience, ideally with a diverse team in a high performing business. We’d prefer you to have a dairy farming background but if you’re career has been in the rural sector and you’re keen to learn the technical aspects of dairy farm management we certainly have the expertise to support this.§What’s most important to us is that you are organised, love creating systems that work for the people and the business, and can lead and advocate for your team. You will enjoy working within a corporate farming system and also have the enthusiasm, energy and commitment of an owner-operator, keen to see their business succeed.§·if you love working in a business that performs§· You can balance relating and requiring competencies to get the best out of people and the team§· You will thrive in a role where you’re running the management interface between the team and business owner, please submit an application and we look forward to speaking to you.§§§§
