We offer dog and cat boarding with Motel and Hotel options to suit the individual. We also have doggy day care for socialising, playing and exercise in the fresh countryside air, with three off-leash paddocks and a forest ready for exploring. Health, safety and cleaning is paramount to us, which helps keep animals happy and well cared for.§ § § §The Role§ §We are looking for a superstar animal attendant who can commit to working 4 days a week, with full flexibility (weekends and public holidays are essential and non-negotiable). Set days will be Sunday, Monday, Wednesday and Thursday but ability to fill in on other days is a must.§ §Duties include:§ § §Dog socialisation and monitoring canine behaviour and body language§ §Monitoring daily health and wellbeing of cats and dogs§ §LOTS of cleaning and disinfecting of the facilities to a high standard§ §Exercising dogs in our care both on and off-leash§ §Dog bathing and other husbandry duties§ §Feeding and meal prep§ §Administering medications and monitoring health issues§ § § §Qualifications and Experience§ §The ideal candidate must have experience in the animal care industry and/or hold a relevant qualification such as:§ § §Certificate in Canine Behaviour and Training§ §Certificate in Animal Care§ §Bachelor of Animal Science or Welfare and Management§ §Certificate or Diploma in Veterinary Nursing§ § § §Skills§ §The ideal candidate will have the following qualities:§ § §Confident animal handling skills with all breeds, sizes and temperaments of dogs and cats§ §Passionate about animal welfare§ §Motivated to provide the best care possible§ §Eager to always improve oneself work and knowledge§ §A mature and sincere attitude§ §Physically fit§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §Excellent time management§ §Calm and efficient under pressure and in stressful situations§ §Strong work ethic§ §Able to demonstrate initiative, common sense and a willingness to take responsibility§ §A united team player with effective communication, and confident working as an individual§ §Reliable and punctual§ §Own car and license§ § § §How to Apply§ §If this sounds like you, please apply with a cover letter and CV where indicated.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you available to work public holidays?§§§

company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$80,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§Forest & Bird is New Zealand’s leading membership-based national conservation organisation.  We have a proud history spanning over 90 years advocating for the protection of nature at a national level and in our communities throughout Aotearoa New Zealand.§ §We are looking for a conservation-focused Regional Manager preferably based in Dunedin§.     § §Do you want to be a leading voice for nature across Otago and Southland and help protect nature across New Zealand?  Do you have the skills, courage and aptitude to drive change?  We have a rare opportunity to join the Forest & Bird team as our Southern based Regional Conservation Manager.  § §Regional Conservation Managers (RCMs) are part of a team delivering Forest and Bird’s conservation outcomes by:  § § §Being an enthusiastic voice for nature § §Leading and supporting campaigns on conservation issues within the Otago and Southland region and across the country § §Helping shape environmental protection rules, resource-use decisions, laws and policies across our land, freshwater, and oceans  § §Providing strategic guidance on conservation issues and activities  § §Regional Conservation Managers work as a team to implement the Society’s operational plan and deliver Forest & Bird’s advocacy.  § § Some travel will be a necessary requirement for this position.§ §To be successful in this role, you will need the following:§ § §A tertiary qualification fields relating to conservation, ecology or science is desirable;§ §An ability to maintain and develop relationships with iwi and hapū across the region;§ §Sound working knowledge of New Zealand’s natural environment and conservation issues;§ §Experience dealing with RMA statutory planning processes and conservation legislation;§ §Demonstrated ability to initiate, plan and complete projects on time and within budget;§ §Excellent written and spoken communication skills (with media experience an advantage);§ §Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with a wide range of people;§ §A high level of personal motivation, ability to initiate and complete tasks independently, and in a timely manner;§ §Relevant, current and clean New Zealand driver’s license.§ §To apply, please email your CV and a Cover Letter to Julie Watson at §recruitment@forestandbird.org.nz§ § telling us why you are the person we are looking for.   All applications will be acknowledged with applicants requested to complete an application form if they are successful in securing an interview. The closing date for applications is §5pm, Friday, 9 October§, 2020.§ § § § Specific queries about this role should be directed to Jen Miller, General Manager Conservation Advocacy & Communications on 021 651 778.§ § § §PLEASE NOTE:  §We will only shortlist candidates who have a current legal right to work in New Zealand and a full NZ driver’s license.  Regrettably we are unable to consider you if you do not have this organised.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621157.txt	§Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager§§Advertiser: §Platinum Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§Manager – 3 Year Fixed Term Role§   § §The Organisation § The Otago Peninsula Biodiversity Group (OPBG) as formed in 2008 by residents of the Peninsula with the same vision in mind; protecting the areas biodiversity, lifestyle, and economic values by eradicating mammalian predators.  Since inception the group has grown quickly, and they have over 100 volunteers committed to a range of activities.§   § Currently the groups focus is the eradication of possums and to date they have removed over 16,000 possums from the Peninsula and they are looking for a Manager to take ownership and drive the Otago Peninsula Possum Eradication Project as they work towards their vision: Predator Free Peninsula 2050§   § §The Role§ The primary objective of the Manager is to effectively manage the business delivery, vision and objectives of OPBG ensuring constructive management, development, health, safety and wellbeing of OPBG staff.§ They will be responsible for the day to day operations and execution of the Otago Peninsula Possum Eradication Project implementing work programmes within budget and timeframes.§   § §Key Responsibilities§ § §Lead and drive the OPBG project team in the eradication of Possums from the Otago Peninsula§ §Strategic planning and reporting, respond to changes in environment, priorities and direction, ensuring these are reflected in implementation planning§ §Provide oversight and direction to the employees of OPBG in accordance with OPBG’s policies and procedures.§ §Financial management including budgets, working closely with OPBG treasurer and finance sub-committee.§ §Liaise with key stakeholders to ensure co-ordinated service delivery, maintaining functional relationships with the OPBT Board and other stakeholders.§ §Identify sources of funding, seek funding partners for projects, submit applications and report.§ § § §Person Specifications§ § §Sound knowledge across biodiversity, conservation management and pest control.§ §Demonstrated ability in contract, asset and project management, business processes, data management, strategic management, and allocation of resources.§ §Experience in managing, motivating and developing teams of staff including conflict resolution and the appreciation of diversity.§ §Competent computer skills with strengths in Excel and Word and GIS user capabilities would be advantageous.§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §Valid NZ Drivers License § § § §Why Apply§ This is an excellent opportunity to actually make a difference to a very special region in Dunedin that has already seen an increase in native birds, rejuvenated native tree canopies, fruit trees and healthy vegetable gardens. §With huge collaborative support from volunteers, residents, contractors, the OBPG team, our funders and supporters they are looking for someone who shares their passion and vision of eradicating predators from our incredible Dunedin city.§Interested?§If you have any questions about the position & company feel free to contact Laura on §0277 528462§ for a confidential chat.§This is an excellent opportunity to join a successful company with a solid vision in mind. If this sounds like the right next move in your career, please click APPLY now!§§§§

To be part of a committed team and fillet fish for a good purpose? §The Kai Ika Project is a community led initiative. We collect unwanted fish parts and share them with five marae around Auckland. We’ve already distributed over 90,000kg of fish with whanau who appreciate them.§In October, we are opening a new filleting service at Westhaven Marina. Filleting will be onsite in our brand new purpose-built fish filleting trailer. §We are looking for top notch fish filleters who want to use their skills to feed their community. §This is not your normal factory gig! You will showcase your skills on a daily basis. We aim to inspire the public and showcase the effort and care that goes into each and every single fish. §This is a full time role but hours will be concentrated between Thursday - Sunday. §Being a non profit organisation 100% of surpluses will be reinvested in growing the Kai Ika project. This is not your normal job, you will be filleting for a good cause. §To be eligible you will need to be allowed to legally work in New Zealand, have a current drivers license and have professional fish filleting experience. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50623208.txt	§Vineyard and Winery Apprenticeship §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vineyard and Winery Apprenticeship §§Advertiser: §Booster Wine Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§Booster Wine Group Vineyard & Winery Apprenticeship. § §Booster, through its Booster Tahi investment arm, is making significant investments in New Zealand’s agricultural business including avocados, kiwi fruit, and through investments in Awatere River Wine Company, Waimea Estates, Bannock Brae and Sileni Estates, the wine industry. § §We are looking for a positive, motivated, capable, reliable, hardworking individual to join our team. You will need to be flexible, enjoy the challenge of learning new things, and be able to adapt to changing situations.§ §This is an apprenticeship role with full training provided to the successful applicant. A background in the wine industry is not essential and would be great for someone who has a positive attitude to experience and learn what the New Zealand wine industry is all about!§ §Over time you will learn to:§Operate all winery and vineyard equipment to a high standard.§Communicate effectively with colleagues to confirm that all instructions and objectives are understood by all. §Work well in a team, particularly at busy times of year.  Also be trusted to work unsupervised and arrange tasks yourself.§Any Vineyard and/or cellar experience is an advantage, but not essential. A willingness to learn is equally advantageous.§Promote a culture of quality, efficiency and teamwork in both vineyard and winery.§ §Applicants will require sound attention to detail, strong interpersonal and team skills, motivation, initiative, and the stamina required to be effective in a busy environment. § §This is a balanced role between both vineyard and winery (as a guide: Winery Feb-July, Vineyard June-Feb). The balance between the two would be dependent upon required workflows. § §A hands-on role for someone wanting to grow in a small, focused team in both the vineyard and winery. This is a flexible role that will continue to grow as the company does. If this sounds like you then we look forward to hearing from you!§ §To apply, please send your CV and covering letter to §Annabella.challis@boosterwinegroup.nz§ or click “Apply Now”.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50623779.txt	§Team Manager Circuit South Island (6 month fixed term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Manager Circuit South Island (6 month fixed term)§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Team Manager Circuit South Island (6 month fixed term) §        §          §Team Manager Circuit (South Island) - Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§          §(6-month Fixed Term/Secondment)§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries works to safeguard New Zealander's way of life well into the future.  To ensure this, we have a vision where New Zealand is the worlds most sustainable provider of high-value food and primary products.§          §Each day, almost all New Zealanders interact with our food system.  We grow food, we produce it, we prepare it, we share it and we eat it.  It is what brings us together, nourishes us, sustains us and is the backbone of our economy.  New Zealand food also plays an important role in the lives of overseas consumers, with many millions enjoying our food in over 200 countries.§          §This is an opportunity to take up a key leadership and management position within the Verification Services (VS) Directorate in New Zealand Food Safety. This is a 6 month fixed term/secondment opportunity and is based in Christchurch.§          § §          §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§          §New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programme that ensures all relevant regulatory requirements are met.  Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§          §These include:§          §            §Verification and certification services to ~2000 processing companies.  This not only includes primary and secondary food producers but also storage and transport.§            §Verifying containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the relevant standards to keep New Zealand free of unwanted and new organisms.§            §Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§            §The export meat sector accounts for 80% of the Verification Service's activities. §                §This includes slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§              §            §          §          §VS plays a key role in the Primary Sector industry and the Circuit team delivers verification, certification and inspection services Nationally.  This role is based in Canterbury and covers the wider South Island regions. §          § §          §About the role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§          §This is a unique role that combines two key objectives -§          §            §The responsibility of managing and leading a professional team of skilled people who are based across the South Island who are frontline and operational§            §Provide managerial and leadership support to the existing Team Leaders in supervising the larger circuit to ensure the best possible service is being provided to the industry§          §          §As the Team Manager of the South Island Circuit, based in Christchurch you will lead a team of 22 people made up of team leaders and verifiers.§          §Your roles primary function is to ensure the delivery of high quality and nationally consistent technical and operational services within the circuit.§          §Salary range for this role is $108,685 and $135,857 depending on skills and experience.§          § §          §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§          §To be successful in this role you will need:§          §            §A relevant tertiary qualification§            §Significant experience in people leadership and management and ideally leading a team of frontline operational technical experts§            §Proven experience developing (and operating within) budgets and making decisions with financial impact§            §Experience as a leader and natural collaborator, and in managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders (including senior leaders)§          §          §We are looking for someone who is a positive disruptor who can comfortably challenge current team habits to find positive alternatives in a continuous improvement environment. You need to be adaptable and resilient, thrive in a complex and sometimes ambiguous environment, and be comfortable working with data, analytics and reporting. The ideal person will be able to think creatively, work under pressure, exert influence and prioritise work. We are looking for someone who will bring a high degree of enthusiasm and energy to the role.§          § §          §How to apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin for a confidential discussion on §04 819 4261§ or email §rosie.slevin@mpi.govt.nz§          §Applications for this role close on Sunday 11 October 2020§          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Team Manager Circuit (South Island) - Verification Services - New Zealand Food Safety§§(6-month Fixed Term/Secondment)§The Ministry for Primary Industries works to safeguard New Zealander's way of life well into the future.  To ensure this, we have a vision where New Zealand is the worlds most sustainable provider of high-value food and primary products.§Each day, almost all New Zealanders interact with our food system.  We grow food, we produce it, we prepare it, we share it and we eat it.  It is what brings us together, nourishes us, sustains us and is the backbone of our economy.  New Zealand food also plays an important role in the lives of overseas consumers, with many millions enjoying our food in over 200 countries.§This is an opportunity to take up a key leadership and management position within the Verification Services (VS) Directorate in New Zealand Food Safety. jobTitle: Senior Vet Nurse - Morrinsville Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624381.txt	§Senior Vet Nurse - Morrinsville§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Vet Nurse - Morrinsville§§Advertiser: §Anexa Veterinary Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Vet Nurse - Morrinsville §      §        §          §Career development opportunity§          §Supportive and friendly mixed practice team§          §Values and people-driven business§        §        §Our Values: Think Team, Do the right thing, Challenge, Commit and Deliver§        §Join Anexa Veterinary Services in a Senior Vet Nurse role as part of our Morrinsville team. This is a varied role in which you will be an important part in leading the day to day running of the clinic, alongside the companion animal team.§        §About us§        §Anexa Veterinary Services has 12 veterinary clinics across the Waikato and Hauraki Plains providing services to both companion animals and farming clients. Each of our clinics are unique but at Anexa we are one team.§        §About the clinic§        §Our Morrinsville clinic is committed to growing their companion animal business and delivering the best service to clients and their beloved pets. It is a fast-paced clinic where no two days are the same. It is imperative that you are a team player and love getting stuck in to get the job done.§        §It is a mixed practice with a companion animal team currently consisting of 1-2 veterinarians (day-dependent) and 2 nurses.§        §The clinic is equipped with:§        §          § Idexx haematology and biochemistry in-house blood machines§          §Internal laboratory with dedicated lab technicians and microbiologists§          §Anaesthetic monitoring equipment including ECG, pulse oximetry, apnoea alert, temperature probe and blood pressure measurement§          §Digital x-rays and ultrasound§          §Two consulting rooms, a large treatment room and a separate sterile surgery room§          §Separate kennel room, plus separate isolation room§        §        §About the role§        §This is an exciting opportunity to support the Companion Animal Team Leader in the day to day running of the clinic and to have significant input in creating an efficient service for pets, clients, and our vets.§        §You will be the first port of call for our companion animal vets and will be integral to managing client relationships. Surgical support, anaesthesia, patient monitoring and treatment, admitting and discharging pets and communicating with clients will be the main priorities of this role. Nurse consults e.g. post-operative checks, dental checks etc are also an important aspect that we would like to grow.§        §There are significant development opportunities available in this role. You will play a valuable part in developing the breadth and efficiency of our day to day companion animal services while being well-supported with ongoing clinical CPD (both internal and external). Anexa recognises the importance of supporting our nurses to continually grow their clinical knowledge and skill set.§        §About you§        §You will be a qualified and experienced Vet Nurse. Team leadership experience is preferable but not essential. You will be a natural leader and dedicated to providing the best care and service to all clients and their pets. You will be computer literate and have excellent written and verbal skills.§        §You will thrive in a busy environment, have great rapport with clients and their pets and pride yourself in fostering positive relationships with all our valued Morrinsville clients. The ideal candidate will always be looking to drive the day forward in an efficient manner; aiming to be one step ahead of the veterinarian, showing initiative and pre-empting their requirements.§        §The words efficient, driven, and proactive describe your work ethic. You aim to provide a high level of care and service to companion animals that not only meets, but regularly exceeds, our clients’ expectations.§        §How to apply§        §Please submit your CV and a Cover Letter via Seek.§        §Applications close on Monday 12 October and will be screened on an incoming basis.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Career development opportunity§ §Supportive and friendly mixed practice team§ §Values and people-driven business§ §Our Values: Think Team, Do the right thing, Challenge, Commit and Deliver§  §Join Anexa Veterinary Services in a Senior Vet Nurse role as part of our Morrinsville team. This is a varied role in which you will be an important part in leading the day to day running of the clinic, alongside the companion animal team.§  §About us§  §Anexa Veterinary Services has 12 veterinary clinics across the Waikato and Hauraki Plains providing services to both companion animals and farming clients. Each of our clinics are unique but at Anexa we are one team.§  §About the clinic§  §Our Morrinsville clinic is committed to growing their companion animal business and delivering the best service to clients and their beloved pets. It is a fast-paced clinic where no two days are the same. It is imperative that you are a team player and love getting stuck in to get the job done.§  §It is a mixed practice with a companion animal team currently consisting of 1-2 veterinarians (day-dependent) and 2 nurses.§  §The clinic is equipped with:§ § § Idexx haematology and biochemistry in-house blood machines§ §Internal laboratory with dedicated lab technicians and microbiologists§ §Anaesthetic monitoring equipment including ECG, pulse oximetry, apnoea alert, temperature probe and blood pressure measurement§ §Digital x-rays and ultrasound§ §Two consulting rooms, a large treatment room and a separate sterile surgery room§ §Separate kennel room, plus separate isolation room§ §About the role§  §This is an exciting opportunity to support the Companion Animal Team Leader in the day to day running of the clinic and to have significant input in creating an efficient service for pets, clients, and our vets.§  §You will be the first port of call for our companion animal vets and will be integral to managing client relationships. Surgical support, anaesthesia, patient monitoring and treatment, admitting and discharging pets and communicating with clients will be the main priorities of this role. Nurse consults e.g. post-operative checks, dental checks etc are also an important aspect that we would like to grow.§  §There are significant development opportunities available in this role. You will play a valuable part in developing the breadth and efficiency of our day to day companion animal services while being well-supported with ongoing clinical CPD (both internal and external). Anexa recognises the importance of supporting our nurses to continually grow their clinical knowledge and skill set.§  §About you§  §You will be a qualified and experienced Vet Nurse. Team leadership experience is preferable but not essential. You will be a natural leader and dedicated to providing the best care and service to all clients and their pets. You will be computer literate and have excellent written and verbal skills.§  §You will thrive in a busy environment, have great rapport with clients and their pets and pride yourself in fostering positive relationships with all our valued Morrinsville clients. The ideal candidate will always be looking to drive the day forward in an efficient manner; aiming to be one step ahead of the veterinarian, showing initiative and pre-empting their requirements.§  §The words efficient, driven, and proactive describe your work ethic. You aim to provide a high level of care and service to companion animals that not only meets, but regularly exceeds, our clients’ expectations.§  §How to apply§  §Please submit your CV and a Cover Letter via Seek.§  §Applications close on Monday 12 October and will be screened on an incoming basis.§§§§

Applications close on 16 October 2020.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Reporting to the COO, our new General Manager Contracting will embrace a diverse position taking ownership and accountability for the day to day running of the business. jobText: TXT/50628597.txt	§Assistant Team Leader (2IC) 2 positions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Team Leader (2IC) 2 positions§§Advertiser: §Waimea Nurseries Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Rest of Tasman§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Assistant Team Leader (2IC) –2 positions§Waimea Nurseries is one of New Zealand’s largest nurseries, growing fruit trees for orchardists, and fruit, ornamental and berry plants for garden retailers. Established in 1971, the nursery now covers over 250 hectares with a mix of field and container tree production. The main nursery site is located 10 minutes from Richmond on the Waimea Plains.§We are on the hunt for some new Assistant Team Leaders for two of our Nursery production teams. Although each of our vacancies will focus on a different aspect of our production, both roles will require the successful candidate to have a love of outdoor physical work, display a ‘lead by example’ attitude, have fantastic interpersonal skills and enthusiasm to learn and develop in the role.§Position 1: Our Retail Field Nursery Team focuses on the production of field grown stone fruit and ornamental trees by overseeing the planting, maintenance and lifting to achieve successful conversion targets. The Retail 2IC will support the Team Leader in leading the production team to achieving optimal results with both the quantity and quality of the product. This role will provide an opportunity for the right individual to grow and develop into a leadership role in a very supported learning environment. A desire to learn about horticulture is essential in this position due to the large amount of tree varieties the Retail Field Team is responsible for, in additional to a love for working with staff in both the challenges and successes that are presented with a leadership position.§Position 2: Our Stoolbeds Team is responsible for the successful production of our rootstocks which form the base of all our trees. Our rootstocks are produced on an annual production cycle with the busiest time of year being the winter harvest season when the team increases from 2 to 14 staff. During the busy season the 2IC will provide support to the Team Leader by overseeing staff and assisting with the planning and coordination of production needs. During summer the Stoolbeds 2IC will provide help with machinery operation and work independently with the total team numbers reducing to 2-4 staff whilst the product is being maintained during its growth cycle. The ability to work both independently and in a large team ins vital for this role with the 2IC responsibilities changing dramatically between seasons.§Key responsibilities of the 2IC role include:§- Completing timesheets and paperwork,§- Training new staff§- Staff performance management§- Motivating and leading the team whilst the Team Leader is absent§- Undertaking physical nursery work which involves bending and squatting§Both roles are fulltime, permanent positions with summer hours from 7.00am – 3.15pm and winter hours 7.30am – 3.45pm.§These positions offer the ability to develop your leadership skills in a supported environment with the very real potential to step up into a Team Leader position with internal promotion being a prominent aspect of the businesses success.§Our standout candidate will display;§ § §Confidence speaking to others both with instructing and starting difficult conversations§ §A desire to learn and develop their leadership skills§ §An infectious positive and motivated attitude, the type of person who helps the team to reach their goals!§ §Proven ability to work outside completing physical work which often involves bending over and squatting§ §A fantastic work ethic and lead by example attitude§ §An interest in horticulture§ §Waimea Nurseries offers a unique friendly and supportive workplace culture with our ‘family orientated’ business structure. Benefits of working at Waimea Nurseries include:§ § §Free end of month staff lunches to promote team building§ §An additional days Birthday leave for all permanent employees§ §Supported NZQA industry specific training§ §Applicants must have a NZ Drivers License and be legally entitled to work in NZ permanently. To apply for either of these position please send your CV and Covering Letter to §elle@waimeanurseries.co.nz§ with the title of the position you wish to apply for in the subject line – either “Retail 2IC” or “Stoolbeds 2IC”.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: 2021 Vintage Cellarhand - Marlborough Job in Marlborough - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628992.txt	§2021 Vintage Cellarhand - Marlborough§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§2021 Vintage Cellarhand - Marlborough§§Advertiser: §Villa Maria Estate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§ A leader in sustainability, innovation and quality, Villa Maria is a family owned winery recognised as an icon in the New Zealand wine industry. Listed as ‘Third Most Admired Wine Brand in the World’ Villa Maria now exports to over 60 countries. We are now seeking Vintage Cellarhands to join us in Marlborough for the 2021 harvest season. So, we need experienced and inexperienced people to join our team as we have different levels of Cellarhand roles to offer.§What we need from you:§  §Share our culture of Health & Safety first and be eager to learn our processes and procedures.§  §Be physically fit and have a positive attitude with a hands-on approach.§  §Be self-motivated and energetic with a great work ethic.§  §The ability to multitask and work well under pressure while having a strong attention to detail.§  §Forklift competency will be highly valued.§What we will offer you:§  §A competitive remuneration rate§  §A daily shift meal§  §Relevant training depending on the experience you bring§  §A safe and supportive work environment§Vintage Cellarhand§If you come with a willingness to learn and have an optimistic, can do attitude and enjoy physical work will be offered a full induction and training program for their role. Previous experience with grape receival, pressing, crushing, barrel work, wine/juice transfer and racking and clarification processes will be a distinct advantage however not essential as we will provide training to ensure you are ready for Harvest.§Senior Vintage Cellarhand§For these roles, you will need to have excellent communication skills as you will work closely with our Area Supervisors and will be assisting with the training, leading and managing small teams of people during Harvest. You must have the ability to competently undertake several tasks at once while also having a strong attention to detail. Previous experience in the winery and a high level of proficiency with most cellar operations are essential. Health and Safety will be your priority while ensuring all operations are completed efficiently and to the highest standard.§If you want to have the opportunity to work with our highly dedicated team of passionate people and make fantastic wines, we would love to hear from you!§We are offering fixed term work for our 2021 harvest period. Shift work will be required and during the peak of harvest working up to 10 hour shifts across 6 days.§Due to border closures we will only be accepting applications from New Zealand Residents or international applicants who are currently in New Zealand.  Evidence of a Work Visa or Residency will be required.§Don't miss out on an opportunity to join our 2021 vintage team. Apply now.  §§§§

jobTitle: Veterinary nurse - Internal Medicine and imaging Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50630115.txt	§Veterinary nurse - Internal Medicine and imaging§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary nurse - Internal Medicine and imaging§§Advertiser: §Animal Referral Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§About the business and the role§  § §  §Animal Referral Centre (ARC) is a busy, growing, private small animal specialist/emergency practice established in 2016. We are independently owned and operated and have specialists in small animal internal medicine, surgery and diagnostic imaging, as well referral services in Cardiology. We also have a referral dermatology service on site and a Hydrotherapy suite.§  §We have all the equipment you would expect in a modern veterinary hospital including full in-house laboratory suite with Radiometer, multiparameter patient monitors, digital radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, mechanical ventilation, on-site CT, and dedicated cat and dog receptions, consulting rooms and wards. §  §We have an opportunity for a nurse to assist with specialised medical procedures such as endoscopy and imaging. This will involve nursing of patients under the care of our internal medicine and diagnostic imaging specialists.§  § §  §Why work for ARC?§ § §You will have the opportunity to be part of a progressive and flourishing business, providing the cutting edge in care for cats and dogs§ §No two shifts are the same and you will gain experience with a wide variety of cases.§ §You will have the opportunity to provide outstanding patient care and use your nursing skills – we expect our nurses to perform triage, place IV catheters, take blood samples, take radiographs, etc.§ §We have a cohesive, friendly work environment and encourage collaboration between our specialist and emergency teams.§ §Competitive remuneration is offered as well as regular in house CPD opportunities and an employee assistance programme.§ §Our practice was profiled in Vetscript December 2018; for more information about us see https://www.nzva.org.nz/news/429254/Bring-in-the-experts.htm§ § §  §Job tasks and responsibilities§  § § § §General nursing of referral patients, including high-dependency cases§ §IV and urinary catheter placement; venipuncture and running of laboratory tests§ §Monitoring anaesthesia§ §Assisting with medical procedures such as endoscopy§ §Managing chemotherapy patients§ §Radiography§ §Assisting with ultrasound, CT and off-site MRI§ §Mentoring and training of junior nurses§ § §  §Skills and experience§  § §  §Our ideal candidate will:§ § §Have at least 2 years experience working as a veterinary nurse§ §Have experience working in a specialist or emergency practice (not essential)§ §Hold a Diploma in Veterinary Nursing or Bachelor of Veterinary Technology degree (or overseas equivalent)§ §Deliver an exceptionally high standard of patient care§ §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Be extremely reliable driven to learn§ §Be a team player§ § §  §Job benefits and perks§  § § § §Membership of the NZVNA§ §In house continuing education programme§ §Continuing education allowance§ §EAP services§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobText: TXT/50630787.txt	§2021 Winery Vintage Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§2021 Winery Vintage Team§§Advertiser: §Sacred Hill Vineyards Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§We require a dynamic cellar crew and a laboratory technician to help us bring in the harvest.§Sacred Hill is one of New Zealand’s leading, multi award-winning wineries. Focusing on the production of premium, handcrafted, varietal wines from the company’s estate and contract vineyards located in New Zealand’s leading grape growing regions of Hawke’s Bay and Marlborough.§All major grape varieties are lovingly crafted into a diverse range of premium and ultra-premium wines by our talented team.§We are looking to have all interns employed by the end of January for induction training. Harvest starts late February to early March and is completed in early May.§We start vintage working 8-hour shifts, 5 days a week and build up to work 12 hour shifts with the winery in operation seven days a week. At the height of harvest, we run two 12-hour shifts, and you will always get one day off each week.§Vintage processing continues until end of May and we reduce our vintage crew during that time. Depending on how the vintage goes, it is possible that we will ask some members of the vintage crew to stay on for an extended period of time.§This year we are looking for three different roles:§Experienced winery/vintage workers (Cellar Supervisors)§These will be the experienced people we can rely on to organise and motivate the cellar team. Great communication, understanding of grape processing and basic winemaking is a huge advantage. Strong leadership skills are a must.§Cellar Hands§It is not necessary to have direct winery experience, but dependable, focused and hardworking people will do well here. If you are process driven, motivated and practical, you will be perfect for the role. All training will be provided. We do ask that you are physically fit, reliable and have a great willingness to learn, because the environment is fast-paced and physically demanding.§Laboratory Technician§This role will need some prior lab experience. Knowledge of basic lab analysis such as sulphurs, brix, pH and TA will be required. A willingness to get outdoors and into the vineyards collecting grape samples will be a huge plus. You’ll be analysing ferments and reporting back to the winemakers throughout your shift.§Why choose to work with us?§We are an award-winning, family owned winery and have been crafting world-class wines for 35 years. We export all over the world and continue to produce some of New Zealand’s most iconic wines. Our people are at the centre of our success and we need your help to ensure another fabulous Hawke’s Bay harvest.§In exchange for your hard work and dedication, we are offering:§- A competitive salary§- The opportunity to work at an award-winning New Zealand winery§- A delicious cooked meal per shift§- A location right next door to a café and micro-brewery§- Excellent induction, training and on-the-job experience§- Wine tastings throughout the winemaking process§- The opportunity to gain experience in an incredibly rewarding industry§- Accommodation assistance§Only people who are physically residing and are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence of your Work Visa or Residency will be required.§Please send your application, a current CV and references to Dominic Smith §Dominic.smith@sacredhill.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50632728.txt	§Practicing / Senior Practicing Veterinarian - Pet Emergency Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practicing / Senior Practicing Veterinarian - Pet Emergency Centre§§Advertiser: §Massey University§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Practicing / Senior Practicing Veterinarian - Pet Emergency Centre §    §    §      §      §      §        §College of Sciences§Palmerston North§        §The School of Veterinary Sciences at Massey University, Palmerston North, invites applications for a§practicingVeterinarian within the Companion Animal Hospital§of the Veterinary Teaching Hospital.§ § We are seeking applications from Veterinarians, ideally with§at least two years of clinical experience in emergency and critical care§, to workin ourEmergency Centre and Critical Care (ECC) Team. There are§two permanent positions available§, each for approximately 30 hours per week.§ § We are looking for an enthusiastic professional, who possesses excellent communication skills, is self-motivated and has a passion for education. As part of Massey Vets, you will be involved in the teaching of Bachelor of Veterinary Science students.§ § §What we offer:§ § Within our Companion Animal Hospital, you will be working alongside Emergency Critical Care Specialists, Emergency veterinarians and Interns in New Zealand’s only Veterinary Teaching Hospital facility. We provide 24/7 Emergency Critical care for Vet clinics throughout the wider Manawatu-Whanganui region. Alongside our Community Practice and Referral clinics, this leads to a both challenging and extremely rewarding work environment. To view a tour of our veterinary teaching hospital please follow this link:§https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21Lm854MfxE§ § § §The position:§ § Both positions are based in our emergency service. The main focus is on delivery of clinical service to clients, support of our rotating interns, and clinical teaching to undergraduate veterinary students. Our AVMA accredited veterinary programme is world-renowned, providing quality, research-led education.The successful applicant will provide high-quality veterinary care as part of a collaborative team of specialists, vets, nurses, interns and students.§ § You will be part of a rotating roster, involving daytime, evening and weekend shifts. There are no scheduled overnight shifts, to ensure a good work-life balance.There is the opportunity to work alongside our specialist team during the weekday shifts to improve your skillset in the areas of your choice. We encourage ongoing professional development and internal-external opportunities are available.§ § §About you:§        §          §You’ll need to have a Bachelor of Veterinary Science or equivalent and be registered (or able to be registered) as a veterinarian in NZ.§          §You’ll ideally have at least two years of clinical emergency and critical care experience§          §You have the drive to develop your emergency and critical care skills further§          §You have the flexibility to work on a rotating roster§          §You are empathetic towards the cultural, emotional and physical state of our clients and patients alike§          §You have a positive attitude and a passion for teamwork, critical care and client relations§          §You have a genuine interest in undergraduate and postgraduate clinical instruction§          §You are eligible to work in NZ§        §        § § Enquiries may be directed to Marieke Wijnen, Practice Manager – Companion Animal Hospital, by email on §M.Wijnen@massey.ac.nz§ § Applications should be made online at§http://massey-careers.massey.ac.nz§        §Closing date: 18 October 2020§Reference number: CS_SVSVTHCAH_518_09/20§        §For further information and to apply online, visit: http://masseyunicareers.nga.net.nz§      §      §      §      §We are inspired by our name §Te Kunenga Ki Pu-rehuroa§; from inception to infinity. Massey is not simply defined by what we do, but by how we do it. As a Tiriti-led University we are committed to demonstrating authentic leadership in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand as we uphold Te Tiriti o Waitangi, the founding document of our nation, and its principles through our practice.§        §        §Toi te mana, toi te reo, toi te Tiriti§      §    §    §  §§§College of Sciences§Palmerston North§The School of Veterinary Sciences at Massey University, Palmerston North, invites applications for a§practicingVeterinarian within the Companion Animal Hospital§of the Veterinary Teaching Hospital.§ § We are seeking applications from Veterinarians, ideally with§at least two years of clinical experience in emergency and critical care§, to workin ourEmergency Centre and Critical Care (ECC) Team. To view a tour of our veterinary teaching hospital please follow this link:§https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21Lm854MfxE§ § § §The position:§ § Both positions are based in our emergency service. jobText: TXT/50637301.txt	§Cattery Assistants§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cattery Assistants§§Advertiser: §Vetlife§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Vetlife is a privately owned veterinary practice with branches throughout Canterbury and Otago.  We are excited that shortly we will move our Timaru team into their brand new, purpose built veterinary clinic where in addition to a top class veterinary service they will also continue to offer a high quality, extended cattery service.  We are therefore looking to build a small team to operate this service on site.§ §The roles will include day to day running of the cattery, taking bookings, keeping a clean and well-organised facility and customer service to cattery clients including picking up and dropping off of their animals.  Providing high quality care for the cats during their stay is at the heart of these roles so a love of cats of all shapes and sizes is an absolute must!  From time to time you may also help in the main clinic with general duties including customer service.  The working hours for these roles will be flexible to provide 7 day a week cover and will therefore include some weekend working.  There may be a possibility of part-time work or a job share arrangement.§ §Key attributes for these positions as well as being an avid cat lover include:§ § §Friendly personality § §Confidence to communicate effectively with our valued client base§ §Team Player§ §Eagerness to learn and ability to adapt to changing priorities calmly and efficiently§ §Confident working with computers§ §Organised and methodical § §The role could suit someone with an animal care background or veterinary nursing qualification and experience in these areas would be a definite advantage.§ §Vetlife prides itself on providing our customers with a friendly and high quality service.  If this sounds like the challenge you need, please submit your expression of interest and CV.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§What's your expected hourly rate?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

If you now wanting to take these skills learnt and step up in your career, this is for you.§ §As a caretaker, you will be responsible for the effective support of a small cattle farm operation and the grounds maintenance and care that goes along with that.§ §You will facilitate and implement learning opportunities for any staff assisting you day to day regarding the care and maintenance of the farm.§ §Working closely with the Director of the organisation and other management, you will help to maximise farm returns in line with business targets while overseeing the maintenance of technical and administrative records where needed.§ §Your duties will include (but not limited to):§ § §Direct staff where appropriate and ensure the application of safe and appropriate animal welfare practices§ §Effectively communicate with management and clearly report day to day changes§ §Provide and implement learning opportunities regarding regenerative agricultural practices§ §Perform farm operations associated with the management of cattle enterprises§ §Manage pasture for landscape and stock health§ §General grounds care and tree maintenance§ §Scheduling repairs, maintenance, and replacement of fences, equipment and machinery§ §Ensure to adhere to health and safety regulations and identify new gaps regularly§ §Assist with the recruitment and training of new staff members if and when requested§ §Prepare and deliver farm operations reports for the management§ §Collaborate with accounting and management staff for budgets and financial reports§ § § §Skills & Experience§ §The ideal candidate will have experience working on a farm, in a hands on physical role, with proven knowledge and a commitment to farming practices.§ §You will have clear communication skills and the willingness to adapt to meet the demands of the position, and have a clear understanding of all aspects associated with livestock, grazing and pasture management.§ §To be considered for the role, it is most important you meet the following criteria§ § §Flexibility and adaptability§ §Proven ability to work collaboratively with staff§ §Sound understanding of the relationship between on-farm activity and financial consequences§ §Keen problem-solving abilities§ §Highly efficient with a hands-on approach to tasks§ §Self-driven and ambitious with demonstrated initiative and excellent decision making skills§ §Great communication skills and respect for cultural differences§ §An understanding of policy and procedure manuals and an understanding of legislation in NZ for farming.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50637739.txt	§Companion Animal Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Companion Animal Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §HUHA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§HUHA VETS STOKES VALLEY ARE HIRING!!!§We are looking for a companion animal vet with excellent skills in client service, patient care and welfare...we are in particular wanting a veterinarian with a passion for surgery. Any orthopedic experience would be put to good use too!§HUHA is an independent animal rescue organisation that includes their own vet clinic. The clinic sees public animals too, so there's a regular supply of normal small animal cases but we also tend to tackle cases that other clinics aren't able to, so we often have quite varied, interesting and rewarding cases.§This would be a great role for a vet who wants to mostly do surgery. There'll be plenty of desexing surgeries but also the option for orthopedics and more challenging surgeries§The most important thing that we're looking for is someone who shares our core value of 'care'. We want you to help us look after animals that might not have other options, that are lost, alone or unwanted. We work with owners and the community to increase the welfare of animals everywhere but we're often at the coalface of practical animal care. On the plus side, we don't have international shareholders that we need to keep happy so we can focus on helping animals in need.§ §This is an incredibly rewarding role where doing the best for animals is the key outcome.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

For confidential enquiries, please contact Rebecca McQueen, HR Business Partner on Rebecca.mcqueen@ngaitahu.iwi.nz§ §        §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Kia hiwa rā!§ §Want to be involved in a farming community that challenges the status quo and supports its people to be the best they can be?§ §Ngāi Tahu Farming's kaupapa (purpose) is best represented by the Ngāi Tahu proverb '§Toitū te Marae o Tāne, Toitū te Marae o Tangaroa, Toitū te Iwi',§ 'when land and water are sustained the people will prosper'.§ §We currently have a casual opportunity for an experienced §Relief Milker§ to join our whānau. The role will support our eight Dairy Farms at Te Whenua Hou (Eyrewell), half an hour north of Christchurch using 64 bale fully automated rotary sheds and utilising the Protrack management system.§ §What can we offer the successful applicant?§ § §Being able to farm and be close to Christchurch means the best of both worlds with the great communities of Oxford, Rangiora and Kaiapoi nearby.§ §100% centre pivot irrigation systems with injected effluent and variable rate technology§ §More time focussed on cows, grass and people through quality infrastructure§ §Great opportunities for learning and career progression§ §Support and guidance with industry leading farming practices and performance§ §As an employer we support the mental wellbeing of our kaimahi and offer fully funded counselling§ §The ideal candidate will be:§ § §Someone with a strong work ethic and a willingness to learn and progress§ §A team player motivated by individual and group success§ §Committed to Ngāi Tahu Farming's quadruple bottom line (social, environmental, cultural and economic pillars)§ §Willing to learn tikanga and te reo Māori.§ §Ngāi Tahu Farming is committed to 'kia hoki ora atu'; ensuring everyone is home safe every day, so before starting with us, you will go through a range of pre-employment checks, including drug and alcohol testing.§ §We will consider and actively encourage internal and external secondments. To apply, please follow the link below and submit your application online. For confidential enquiries, please contact Rebecca McQueen, HR Business Partner on Rebecca.mcqueen@ngaitahu.iwi.nz§ § §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50638950.txt	§Ranger, (Fixed Term), Takapourewa/Stephens Island§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger, (Fixed Term), Takapourewa/Stephens Island§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Rest of Marlborough§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger, (Fixed Term), Takapourewa/Stephens Island §        §          §Do you have strong practical skills and are comfortable being self-reliant on a remote island in the Cook Strait?§          §We are looking for someone who is passionate about the conservation of New Zealand's natural and cultural values, skilled at field delivery of a wide range of tasks including infrastructure and machinery maintenance.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §This position is fixed term of initially 18 months with the possibility of extension up to 36 months.§          §The position is based on Takapourewa and involves a variety of work, from maintenance of infrastructure, weed control, track clearing, minor plant propagation to managing visitors. This remote and isolated location has good accommodation, its own power system and satellite broadband. Proven experience living in isolation is necessary. Relevant mechanical and building skills and experience is important.§          §Due to the remote location of the island and nature of the work, this position would ideally suit a couple through a job share or accompanied position arrangement.§          §The Department jointly manages the island with Ngāti Koata. We are a well equipped, progressive, companion animal practice who thrive on providing excellent customer service and practising a high standard of veterinary medicine. We have five clinics in Tawa, Paremata, Whitby, Plimmerton and Titahi Bay.§  §The position will be approximately 30-40 hours per week plus some weekend work on a rotating roster and will likely include shifts across multiple clinics.§  §We are looking for a Veterinary Nurse who is enthusiastic, proactive and who will give 100% to all areas of vet nursing and strive to provide the best care to our patients and clients. jobText: TXT/50640610.txt	§Experienced Veterinary Nurse - Hospital Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Veterinary Nurse - Hospital Team§§Advertiser: §Animal Referral Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§Experienced Veterinary Nurse Wanted– Animal Referral Centre, Auckland.§ § § §Animal Referral Centre is a private small animal referral practice established in 2016 on the North Shore of Auckland. It is independently owned and operated and has specialists in small animal surgery, diagnostic imaging, internal medicine and cardiology.§ § § §The hospital is well equipped with on-site CT, digital radiology, ultrasound, fluoroscopy and endoscopy. The hospital also has separate cat and dog waiting rooms, consult rooms and wards.§ §ARC nurses are driven, service focused and always striving to develop skills and knowledge to ensure we provide our patients the best quality care. Our nurses are team players that strive for clinical excellence and enjoy working in a positive, upbeat environment.  § §We are looking for a full time nurse to join the team at ARC. This role will primarily involve nursing hospitalised patients, however opportunities for upskilling in surgical, emergency or medical procedure nursing will also be available. The successful applicant will have a strong interest in optimising patient comfort and care, as well as working as part of a team.§ §Applicants for this role must hold a Diploma in Veterinary Nursing or Bachelor of Veterinary Technology degree (or overseas equivalent) and have at least 2 years of veterinary nursing experience.§ §Our ideal candidate will also have the following attributes:§ § § §Preferably (but not required) have experience working in a specialist veterinary hospital.§ § § §Deliver an exceptionally high standard of patient care.§ § § §Be reliable and responsible.§ § § §Have excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ § § §Have excellent computer skills§ § § §Be enthusiastic and willing to learn.§ § § §Flexibility and the capability to manage an ever changing caseload due to emergencies.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§§§

jobTitle: Veterinary Nurse- Casual work Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50640865.txt	§Veterinary Nurse- Casual work§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinary Nurse- Casual work§§Advertiser: §Animal Referral Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § §Animal Referral Centre (ARC) is a busy, growing, private small animal specialist/emergency practice established in 2016. We are independently owned and operated and have specialists in small animal surgery, diagnostic imaging, internal medicine and a cardiology registrar. We also have a newly established hydrotherapy service.§Our caseload is varied and interesting, consisting of a mixture of primary access emergency cases and referral cases from practices in Auckland and beyond. A high proportion of our clients have pet insurance.§We have all the equipment you would expect in a modern veterinary hospital including full in-house laboratory suite with Radiometer, multiparameter patient monitors, digital radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, mechanical ventilation, on-site CT, and dedicated cat and dog receptions, consulting rooms and wards. We have a receptionist on evenings and weekends.§Candidates must have a positive attitude as well as a commitment to delivering high quality care. A veterinary nursing qualification and least 2 years experience as a veterinary nurse is required. Previous referral or emergency nursing experience is preferred.§ §Why work for ARC?§·       No two shifts are the same and you will gain experience with a wide variety of cases.§·       You will have the opportunity to provide outstanding patient care and use your nursing skills – we expect our nurses to perform triage, place IV catheters, take blood samples, take radiographs, etc.§·       We have a cohesive, friendly work environment and encourage collaboration between our specialist and emergency teams.§·       Competitive remuneration is offered.§ §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §General nursing of referral and emergency patients, including high-dependency cases§IV and urinary catheter placement; venipuncture and running of laboratory tests§Monitoring anaesthesia§Assisting with emergency surgical procedures§Radiography§Triage of incoming patients§Some reception duties, though ARC also has receptionists working evenings and weekends§ § §Skills and experience§ §The successful candidate will:§Have at least 2 years experience working as a veterinary nurse§Hold a Diploma in Veterinary Nursing or Bachelor of Veterinary Technology degree (or overseas equivalent)§Deliver an exceptionally high standard of patient care§Have excellent written and verbal communication skills§Be extremely reliable & willing to work shifts, including weekends & public holidays§Be a team player§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a nurse?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary nursing?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobTitle: QUALITY CONTROLLER Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50640908.txt	§QUALITY CONTROLLER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§QUALITY CONTROLLER§§Advertiser: §A S Wilcox & Sons Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Due to an internal promotion, we have a great opportunity for an experienced QC to join our Onion Export team.  The role is full time with a seasonal loading from end of January till end of May (5 day roster Monday – Saturday) with a focus on exporting of crop to global markets.  During the off season June – December the role is Monday – Friday.§ §We are looking for a QC who will support the QC Team Leader in  providing training to our grading staff and monitoring of product to ensure it meets customer specification. You will be responsible for monitoring product through the storing and packing processes to ensure it conforms to specification.  Ideally you will have knowledge and/or experience of NZ Gap, GlobalGap, WQA and HACCP and dealing with MAF procedures and requirements in documentation and preparing and  product for export.   There is an added requirement for all exports to UK and Europe to be phyto certified.  The successful candidate for this role will either already have the phyto certification or be prepared to undergo the training to be phyto fit for the season.   You will also support the business with monitoring stored product and undertaking laboratory testing of product as required§ §To be successful in this role we are looking for a candidate with the following attributes:§ § § §QC experience within the food industry§ § § §Phyto sanitary inspection certificate – preferred§ § § §Excellent command of English language, both written and verbal§ § § §Confidence in using Excel and word and ability to learn in house programmes as required§ § § §Previous experience in supervision of staff - preferred§ § § §Tertiary qualified - preferred but not essential§ § §You will be a hands on member of a high performing and well respected team of Quality Controllers within our business where issues are addressed promptly and communicated well.  You will need to be able to work autonomously and have confidence in your abilities, back your own decisions and be prepared to implement them. § §If this role sounds like its made for you, send your cv and covering letter to §jan.bott@aswilcox.co.nz§.§ §Pre employment drug screening is part of our recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§Have you completed a qualification in horticulture?§§§

jobTitle: Crop Agronomist Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640952.txt	§Crop Agronomist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Crop Agronomist§§Advertiser: §Watties§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§About the Role:§ §This is your chance to join our established and knowledgeable crop supply team at out Christchurch Site in a key role delivering vegetable crops to the factory for freezing and dehydrating.   You will be working with individual growers to advise and oversee agricultural practices to ensure we produce the best product possible meeting quality specifications determined by our customers’ expectations. Crops are scheduled and harvested by the company to supply factory demand to produce frozen vegetable for domestic and international markets.§ § The role requires you to work both independently and within the site Crop Supply team.  Our team is well respected in the industry and you will thrive in our team with your strong communication skills across all stakeholders.§ §About You:§ §Previous experience in a similar role would be an advantage, however a graduate with a farming background and an appropriate Agronomic qualification will be considered, but a great attitude will be required to stand out.§ §Ideally, you will bring your practical experience in crop production within the Canterbury region, along with technical knowledge and a tertiary qualification in Agriculture/Horticulture.  Understanding of the importance for food producers of: - food safety, food quality, workplace safety, and environmental sustainability is a given.  You must demonstrate the ability to communicate effectively with growers, contractors, and internal stakeholders including harvest team, production team, and management.§ §You will need:§ § §A great attitude and to be driven to achieve§ §To champion Safety at all times§ §Strive for quality and sustainability in everything you do§ §IT skills are a must§ §Desire and ability to learn and grow§ §To be self-organised and be excellent at prioritising your workload§ §To hold a full, clean driver licence§ §What we offer:§ § §The true ownership to influence the success of the World’s 5th largest food company§ §An opportunity to learn from the best and to make you mark on the future§ §A role where no 2 days are ever the same§ §To be part of a great team both in Christchurch and globally§ §A Company rewards scheme that recognizes personal achievement§ §Benefits program:§ §We empower our people to own their work, and it’s true our employees are our competitive advantage – so we take care of our Kraft Heinz family with our ‘Live Well’ benefits program:§ § §Gatherings - End of Year Celebration§ §Wellbeing – annual health checks & flu shots, wellbeing sessions & webinars§ §Parental Leave - 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers§ §The Kraft Heinz Company Australia & New Zealand is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces, promotes and values diversity and inclusion§ §Bring your appetite for more!§ §Applications close on Sunday 25th October 2020. Applications may be reviewed and interviews conducted prior to the close date so don’t wait – apply now!§§§§§

The other associate in this clinic has strengths in internal medicine and clinical pathology, so we would be looking for a candidate with complimentary strengths to create a robust team.  The clinic is well equipped with digital x-ray, haematology and chemistry in-house blood machines, doppler blood pressure, friendly nurses and snacks!§ §Here are just a few of the key responsibilities that you will be contributing to together with the rest of our team:§ § §Client consultations§ §Hands-on small animal surgery & diagnostics§ §Working collaboratively with your colleagues on patient cases§ § This role is full-time with some flexibility with regards to the roster, including shared Saturdays.§ § § §About You§ § §Genuinely care for pets, your colleagues and our clients§ §Work well both in a team and independently§ §High level of integrity and are interested in continued development§ §Have a Veterinary degree registerable in New Zealand§ §Enjoy working in a busy small animal clinic§ §Experience preferred but new grads welcome to apply§ § § §What’s on Offer?§ § §Generous remuneration§ - commensurate with experience§ §Strong focus on personal development§ with an ongoing focus on your career interests§ §Non-corporate family workplace culture§ – become a member of the CareVets family§ §Fantastic location§ in growing west Auckland, lots of nearby amenities & easy access§ §Work-Life balance is important to us§, so hours are geared with this in mind§ §Dynamic & supportive clinic team§ along with a responsive leadership team§ §Access to a wide network of like-minded colleagues§ across the North Island (and the opportunities that come with such a network)§ § § §To express your interest in this role ‘apply now’ via SEEK with your CV and cover letter attached.  Any applicants shortlisted will be contacted directly.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in veterinary science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§
