jobText: TXT/50702518.txt	§M Health New Zealand Ltd - Bee Keeper§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§M Health New Zealand Ltd - Bee Keeper§§Advertiser: §The Regions Immigration and Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§About the business§ § § §M Health NZ Ltd§ § § §About the role§ § § §Position is based in Kerikeri, Northland. Some travel outside of Kerikeri may be required.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Remuneration dependent on experience§ §Average of 40 hours per week, 7am-5pm (some hours outside of this roster may be required)§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Job Description§:§ § § §-To pursue the highest standards of hive management and beekeeping practice. Possess the right behaviour and attitude to maximise the yield per hive. Learn new skills and follow instructions. Here are some of the tasks that will be required of you:§ §-Coordinate, plan and organise operational requirements to ensure designated hives are maintained at optimum standards for the production of honey, pollen, beeswax and all related products§ §-Help to manage all area Manuka Health hives as part of a team through the season, ensuring round expectations, as passed on from the National Apiculture Manager, are achieved within the prescribed time frame.§ §-Achieve agreed hive standards and maintain pre, during and post Manuka cropping season Perform all required tasks and objectives to a high standard§ §-Land Owner/JV relationships are maintained in a positive manner§ §-All data is recorded and communicated in a timely and accurate manner§ §Applicants must have the following as per employer's requirement:  § §Applicants must provide at least 2 verifiable references of employment history and have a skill set of the required level§Applicants must provide verifiable references of being health and safety compliant§ §      •     Must not have been previously convicted.§ §      •     Applicants must be physically fit.§ §      •     Applicants must be able to pass pre-employment drug test.§ §            At least 1-2 years relevant experience is required§ § § §Please apply with CV before the 22nd October § § §§§§

jobTitle: Park Ranger-Animals and Birds Job in Wellington - SEEK
xenophobe: You will need NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa plus a full NZ driver’s license.  Anyone looking for short term work need not apply.
jobText: TXT/50702624.txt	§Park Ranger-Animals and Birds§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Park Ranger-Animals and Birds§§Advertiser: §Staglands Wildlife Reserve§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§We are looking for a Park Ranger to take care of the birds and animals in The Reserve. Someone who has completed some studies involving animal husbandry would be ideal for this position.  § §Good verbal and written communication skills are essential.  § §You will need to be available to work one day in the weekend as well as school and public holidays.§ §Staglands is located in the beautiful Akatarawa Valley, 20 minutes by car from Upper Hutt, therefore good reliable transport is a must. § §The role involves:§ § §Feeding and cleaning of the animals and enclosures§ §Moving stock as required§ §Maintaining animal records§ §Grooming enclosures and other areas to ensure they are neat and tidy for our visitors§ §Basic maintenance§ §Using equipment such as leaf blower, lawn mower, chain saw etc§ §Ensuring all our customers are wowed by their experience at the park§ §You will need to demonstrate:§ § §An interest in wildlife and conservation§ §Good eye for detail and observation skills§ §Experience and understanding of all aspects of animal husbandry § §A stable work record ie minimum of 2 years with one employer§ §Knowledge of animal welfare issues and current industry best practice§ §Good attitude towards your work colleagues and workplace§ §Understanding of the importance of health and safety in the workplace§ §Ability to follow workplace procedures and paperwork as required§ §This position is primarily working with the animals and birds to ensure they are getting the best care possible at Staglands but you are also likely to be doing some gardening and park presentation work. § §This is a physical job. There is lifting involved and a good level of fitness is essential. You must be able to prove you can work outside in all weathers and dig deep when the going gets tough. § §You will be regularly interacting with our customers so you must have a personable manner and enjoy working with people. Your ability to communicate with a wide range of people will be critical to your success at Staglands.§ §Part of your job will involve Tractor Trailer Rides so tractor experience would be an advantage, but training can be given to someone with the right attitude. Awareness of the importance of adhering to safety procedures is essential.§ §You must be able to work in the weekends, public and school holidays.§ §You will need NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa plus a full NZ driver’s license.  Anyone looking for short term work need not apply.§ §If you think this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. § §Please email your CV, with two referees plus a covering letter out lining why you are perfect for the role to §sarah@staglands.co.nz§. § §Please clearly state the position you are applying for. § §We will acknowledge we have received your application but will only contact applicants we wish to interview.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50704683.txt	§Vineyard Assistant Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vineyard Assistant Manager§§Advertiser: §TvA Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§This role is Awatere Valley based, reporting to the Vineyard Manager and property owner.  While you are second in-charge, you will still be very much "hands on" in our vineyard.  The successful applicant will be required to demonstrate both hands-on and management experience in all aspects of vineyard operations.§ §Tasks include:§ § §supervising contract staff / seasonal workers§ §assist in training of some staff§ §undertake disease monitoring§ §undertake crop estimation§ §operating a range of vineyard machinery§ §irrigation and trellising maintenance§ §vineyard development§ §vine pruning, including individual work with stressed vines§ §ensure vineyard runs under Sustainable Wine Growing NZ policies§ §all of the required record-keeping associated with the above tasks§ §any other vineyard tasks as required§ §About you:§ § §3 years’ plus experience in viticulture§ §you may have a tertiary qualification in viticulture§ §personal pride in carrying out your work to a high standard and a desire for continuous improvement§ §a good eye for quality§ §be computer literate§ §a good communicator (both verbal and written)§ §as a minimum, hold a clean class 1 drivers’ licence§ §hold a Grow Safe certificate§ §First Aid certificate - preferred but not essential§ §To be considered for the role, you must be eligible or able to get eligibility to work in New Zealand.§ §This full-time role comes with a remuneration package that reflects the experience of the successful candidate.§§§§

jobTitle: Cellar Supervisor Job in Gisborne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709239.txt	§Cellar Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cellar Supervisor§§Advertiser: §GisVin Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§If the idea of working in a cutting-edge winery, in a world-class, multicultural wine region appeals – and you don't mind equally world-class sun, surf, sand and food – then we need to hear from you!§GisVin produces a wide range of wines for some of the country's and the world's largest wine brands. Working to the highest standards (we are BRCGS certified with a double A rating), we are looking for a motivated experienced Cellar Supervisor to join our team. §The Cellar Supervisor works closely with the Cellar Master to assist in the smooth running of the winery cellar, from the entry of the grapes through the bottling stage and distribution. This includes assisting with the upkeep of the cellar, such as hygiene and maintenance, and hands-on operation of machinery and involvement with the wine-making process. §The position requires:§Sufficient practical harvest experience, in medium-sized wineries or bigger, as an Assistant Winemaker or Cellar Supervisor, to be able to competently work with our large machinery.§Practical experience in undertaking wine/juice additions, tank/line sanitising, and plant operation and hygiene.§A detailed knowledge of winery processes, including flotation, pressing and RDV operations.§Knowledge of winery operating systems.  Experience with Vintrace would be advantageous.§Experience in off-season winery processing.§Knowledge of HACCP/GFSi programme is preferred.§A demonstrable passion for wine and for producing outstanding quality driven wines.§Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.§Excellent time-management and self-motivational skills, with the ability to be proactive and work unsupervised in the off-season.§Great attention to detail and to follow direction.§The ability to multi-task and adapt to situations under pressure.§Willingness to work weekends and evenings, where the harvest and the processing requires it.§In return for your passion, we offer a competitive remuneration package and a full ongoing training programme. §If this sounds like you, please click on the "Apply Now" button, tell us about your experience and attach a CV including details of referees. §Closing date for applications - 9th November 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Veterinarian - New Plymouth  Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50710965.txt	§Veterinarian - New Plymouth §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Veterinarian - New Plymouth §§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Veterinarian - New Plymouth §        §          §Veterinarian - New Plymouth | Verification Services | New Zealand Food Safety §          §            §Are you a Veterinarian looking for an exciting role based in New Plymouth?§            §Are you passionate about protecting New Zealand and growing our export food industry?§          §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries works to safeguard New Zealander's way of life well into the future. To ensure this, we have a vision where New Zealand is the world's most sustainable provider of high-value food and primary products.§          §Each day, almost all New Zealanders interact with our food system. We grow food, we produce it, we prepare it, we share it and we eat it. It is what brings us together, nourishes us, sustains us and is the backbone of our economy.  New Zealand food also plays an important role in the lives of overseas consumers, with many millions enjoying our food in over 200 countries.§          §This is an opportunity to take up a key Veterinary verifier position within the Verification Services (VS) Directorate in New Zealand Food Safety. The North Island Circuit team is seeking applicants for a Veterinary Technical Supervisor 2 for the Whanganui Circuit team based in New Plymouth.§          § §          §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§          §New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services' (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that meet all regulatory requirements. Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§          §These include:§          §            §Verification and certification services to at least 2000 processing companies. This not only includes food primary and secondary food producers but also storage and transport.§            §Verifying containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the standards around unwanted and new organisms.§            §Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§            §The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities. §                §This includes slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§              §            §          §          §VS plays a key role in the Primary Sector industry and the Circuit team delivers verification, certification and inspection services Nationally. This role is focused in the Taranaki region but may infrequently involve travel Nationally.§          § §          §About the Role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§          §This role provides an opportunity for a registered veterinarian to work mainly under the Animal Products Act. As a warranted Animal Products Officer, you will carry out verification activities in accordance with current legislation and overseas market access requirements. This role also includes the inspection of animals and documentation to support the export and import of live animals and may involve periods of work at a Taranaki Meat Abattoir Establishment during their busy times. You will be based in the Taranaki region and you will travel around the region to carry out the verification functions.§          §We are looking for someone who enjoys a fast-paced work environment where no two days are the same. Full training is provided to the successful applicant.§          §If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!§          § §          §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§          §To be successful in this role you will need:§          §            §To be a qualified and registered Veterinarian§            §Excellent verbal and written skills as well as analytical reasoning skills§            §Integrity and trust, ethics and values, resilience, adaptability and openness§            §Persuading and influencing, teamwork, planning and organising§            §Computer literacy - can operate standard and customised software to an acceptable standard (§e.g.,§ word-processing, excel, internet, email, database, secure sites, electronic certification, residues §etc.§)§            §An understanding of basic food technology would be an advantage§          §          §We are looking for someone who is adaptable and can thrive in a complex and sometimes ambiguous environment. The ideal person will be able to think creatively, work under pressure, and prioritise work. We are looking for someone who will bring a high degree of enthusiasm and energy to the role.§          § §          §How to Apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae) please "APPLY NOW" in order to be directed to our website.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin on §04 819 4261§ or by emailing §Rosie.Slevin@mpi.govt.nz§          §Please note, given this position is safety sensitive the preferred applicant/s for the position will be required to undergo a drug and alcohol pre-employment screening test. Further information on this process can be found on our careers site under the application process, on pre-employment checks.§          § §          §Applications close: Sunday 25 October 2020§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Veterinarian - New Plymouth | Verification Services | New Zealand Food Safety §§Are you a Veterinarian looking for an exciting role based in New Plymouth?§Are you passionate about protecting New Zealand and growing our export food industry?§§ §The Ministry for Primary Industries works to safeguard New Zealander's way of life well into the future. To ensure this, we have a vision where New Zealand is the world's most sustainable provider of high-value food and primary products.§Each day, almost all New Zealanders interact with our food system. We grow food, we produce it, we prepare it, we share it and we eat it. It is what brings us together, nourishes us, sustains us and is the backbone of our economy.  New Zealand food also plays an important role in the lives of overseas consumers, with many millions enjoying our food in over 200 countries.§This is an opportunity to take up a key Veterinary verifier position within the Verification Services (VS) Directorate in New Zealand Food Safety. The North Island Circuit team is seeking applicants for a Veterinary Technical Supervisor 2 for the Whanganui Circuit team based in New Plymouth.§ §About our team - Mō tō mātou rōpū§New Zealand Food Safety - Verification Services' (VS) core purpose is to deliver independent, cost effective and high-quality verification, certification, inspection and clearance programmes that meet all regulatory requirements. Our people deliver a world-class, efficient and cost-effective service to a broad range of animal product industries and sectors and facilitate not only food safety, but biosecurity and market access for animals and animal product exports.§These include:§§Verification and certification services to at least 2000 processing companies. This not only includes food primary and secondary food producers but also storage and transport.§Verifying containment and transitional facilities to ensure they are meeting the standards around unwanted and new organisms.§Inspection and certification of live animals for import and export.§The export meat sector accounts for 80% of Verification Service's activities.§This includes slaughterhouses, meat and fish packhouses, cold storage facilities and other specialised premises processing animal products.§§§VS plays a key role in the Primary Sector industry and the Circuit team delivers verification, certification and inspection services Nationally. This role is focused in the Taranaki region but may infrequently involve travel Nationally.§ §§About the Role - Kōrero mō te tūranga§This role provides an opportunity for a registered veterinarian to work mainly under the Animal Products Act. As a warranted Animal Products Officer, you will carry out verification activities in accordance with current legislation and overseas market access requirements. This role also includes the inspection of animals and documentation to support the export and import of live animals and may involve periods of work at a Taranaki Meat Abattoir Establishment during their busy times. You will be based in the Taranaki region and you will travel around the region to carry out the verification functions.§We are looking for someone who enjoys a fast-paced work environment where no two days are the same. Full training is provided to the successful applicant.§If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!§ §Skills and Experience - Ngā Pūkenga me ngā Wheako§To be successful in this role you will need:§§To be a qualified and registered Veterinarian§Excellent verbal and written skills as well as analytical reasoning skills§Integrity and trust, ethics and values, resilience, adaptability and openness§Persuading and influencing, teamwork, planning and organising§Computer literacy - can operate standard and customised software to an acceptable standard (§e.g.,§ word-processing, excel, internet, email, database, secure sites, electronic certification, residues §etc.§)§An understanding of basic food technology would be an advantage§§We are looking for someone who is adaptable and can thrive in a complex and sometimes ambiguous environment. The ideal person will be able to think creatively, work under pressure, and prioritise work. We are looking for someone who will bring a high degree of enthusiasm and energy to the role.§ §How to Apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae) please "APPLY NOW" in order to be directed to our website.  For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§If you have any questions about the role, you may contact the Recruitment Adviser, Rosie Slevin on §04 819 4261§ or by emailing §Rosie.Slevin@mpi.govt.nz§Please note, given this position is safety sensitive the preferred applicant/s for the position will be required to undergo a drug and alcohol pre-employment screening test. Further information on this process can be found on our careers site under the application process, on pre-employment checks.§ §Applications close: Sunday 25 October 2020§The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709939.txt	§Regional Partner, Extension Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Partner, Extension Services§§Advertiser: §OSPRI§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§West Coast§, §Greymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Regional Partner, Extension Services §      §        §About OSPRI§        §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation which operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§        §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products. TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§        §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility.§        §What will you be doing? §        §The Regional Partner, Extension Services' primary role is to support farmers, industry groups, and other key stakeholders on their obligations towards traceability and animal disease management.§        §This includes delivering extension services through running workshops and events in the region, building relationships with the community, and preparing and communicating planned operation activities with farmers, stakeholders, the relevant councils and community groups.§        §In this customer-centric role, a proven success of people and process management is matched with an understanding or interest in primary industries, farm management, and OSPRI’s services. Often the direct point of call for farmers and landowners, this position will also look for opportunities to partner with organisations to extend OPSRI’s reach and make improvements through engagement with industry groups.§        §    What we’re looking for§        §          §A motivated self-starter, who takes pride in delivering exceptional results for their customers§          §Is effective at building a professional partnership to ensure great results§          §Able to autonomously and within in a team§          §Has an understanding or an interest in primary industries, farm management, and the importance of biosecurity§          §Can co-ordinate, collate, analyse and report outcomes to an array of audiences of varied interests, skills, and backgrounds§          §Is experienced liaising with farmers, with a strong reputation of extension services§          §Holds a strong customer-centric work ethic, who takes on new opportunities and challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy and enthusiasm§          §Is willing to travel around the Upper South Island region; overnight travel is required §          §Able to use a variety of technology and tools including Microsoft 365 products, mobile devices, online applications §          §Able to balance field and office duties effectively§        §        §In return we offer §        §          §A supportive and energetic team, interesting and exciting work and development opportunities§          §Flexible working options§          §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§          §Annual flu vaccinations§          §Employee Assistance Program§          §Wellness Checks§        §        §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz.§        §How to apply§       §        §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§        §Applications close at 5 pm, Friday 06 November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received. We encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience§        §Please note §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory and this role requires a Ministry of Justice criminal history check and pre-employment drug and alcohol testing§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About OSPRI§ §OSPRI is a non-profit organisation which operates in partnership with New Zealand’s primary industries and government to achieve on-farm biosecurity objectives through animal disease management and traceability.  We work closely with our shareholders, Beef and Lamb New Zealand, Dairy NZ, Deer Industry New Zealand and the Ministry for Primary Industries, plus a range of other stakeholders, to deliver on our value statement: §Farmers and markets can depend on us to provide assurance as to the health and status of animals§.§ §OSPRI has a key role in the biosecurity system to contribute to New Zealand’s national and international reputation in animal products. TBfree and National Animal Identification and Tracing are OSPRI programmes.§ §With a new Chief Executive at the helm, significant and exciting changes have been made over the last 12 months and the next step in OSPRI’s evolution is to establish a high performing, collaborative and forward-thinking organisation with a strong emphasis on organisational agility.§ §What will you be doing? § §The Regional Partner, Extension Services' primary role is to support farmers, industry groups, and other key stakeholders on their obligations towards traceability and animal disease management.§ §This includes delivering extension services through running workshops and events in the region, building relationships with the community, and preparing and communicating planned operation activities with farmers, stakeholders, the relevant councils and community groups.§ §In this customer-centric role, a proven success of people and process management is matched with an understanding or interest in primary industries, farm management, and OSPRI’s services. Often the direct point of call for farmers and landowners, this position will also look for opportunities to partner with organisations to extend OPSRI’s reach and make improvements through engagement with industry groups.§ §    What we’re looking for§ § §A motivated self-starter, who takes pride in delivering exceptional results for their customers§ §Is effective at building a professional partnership to ensure great results§ §Able to autonomously and within in a team§ §Has an understanding or an interest in primary industries, farm management, and the importance of biosecurity§ §Can co-ordinate, collate, analyse and report outcomes to an array of audiences of varied interests, skills, and backgrounds§ §Is experienced liaising with farmers, with a strong reputation of extension services§ §Holds a strong customer-centric work ethic, who takes on new opportunities and challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy and enthusiasm§ §Is willing to travel around the Upper South Island region; overnight travel is required § §Able to use a variety of technology and tools including Microsoft 365 products, mobile devices, online applications § §Able to balance field and office duties effectively§ §In return we offer § § §A supportive and energetic team, interesting and exciting work and development opportunities§ §Flexible working options§ §Employer funded Life and Trauma Insurance§ §Annual flu vaccinations§ §Employee Assistance Program§ §Wellness Checks§ §Please view a copy of the position description by visiting https://www.ospri.co.nz/careers/vacancies/ or email careers@ospri.co.nz.§ §How to apply§       § §To apply please click ‘Apply for this role’ and include your cover letter and CV.§ §Applications close at 5 pm, Friday 06 November 2020. §We will be assessing and interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received. We encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience§ §Please note §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory and this role requires a Ministry of Justice criminal history check and pre-employment drug and alcohol testing§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50711804.txt	§Agricultural Scientist (Avocado)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Agricultural Scientist (Avocado)§§Advertiser: §Southern Produce Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§$100,000 - $119,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Agronomy & Farm Services§§§§§§AVOCO is New Zealand’s leading Avocado exporter. New Zealand’s isolated location as regards proximity to horticultural markets for time affected produce means that the ability to manage the supply chain is a significant challenge. To this end, AVOCO is looking to expand its technical team, and is looking for a unique blend of Agricultural Science (specialising in Avocados), supply chain and in-market experience to join our team for the 2021-22 season (Note that at this stage, this is a 1 year fixed term contract, starting in June of 2021, in time for the 2021/22 season).§It is the AVOCO growers’ desire to maintain profitability while at the same time striving to enrich the natural systems in which production is taking place. The avocado community has fully embraced the principle of “Te Taiao” described in the Primary Industries recently released strategy “fit for a better world”. It is imperative that the person applying for the position has the experience and desire to develop production methods which produce the best of fruit while minimizing impacts on the environment; enhancing the “ability to grow sustainably and effectively”.§Ideally, the candidate would have the following characteristics:§Post graduate level study in Agricultural Science (Avocado specialisation)§10 years post study Avocado growing, technical and supply chain and in-market work experience§Able to advise growers of on-farm best-practice regarding all aspects of growing, including disease, ferterliser issues§Able to present on technical matters to Growers and Post-harvest Entities at Grower and Packer meetings§To ensure that fruit is handled to improve fruit quality, gate to plate, demonstrable experience to advise:§shipping lines on best-practice regarding container conditions§international service providers in-market on best-practice§retail customers staff on in-store best-practice§Demonstrable ability in written communication as regards reports and articles for publication§Knowledge of Avocado Compliance Programs, and Quality Management systems§ §Expected salary range would be $105k to $120k, subject to qualifications and experience.§Please send your CV and covering letter giving further background information relevant to your application to: michael@southernproduce.co.nz [link removed]  §§§§

jobText: TXT/50710111.txt	§Horticulture Programme Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Horticulture Programme Manager§§Advertiser: §Rural Directions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Horticulture Programme Manager §      §Wairoa Horticulture Project §      §        §Be an integral part of transforming the Wairoa economy §        §Develop your career §        §Bring your commercial acumen & strong relationship management skills §      §      §        §Recognising Wairoa’s strong land, climate and location advantages and access to readily available water, Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust, Hawkes Bay Regional Council, Ngāti Pāhauwera Development Trust and Wairoa District Council are collaborating to enable the conversion of larger amounts of high-value flat land into horticulture. Developed to its full potential, horticulture could transform the Wairoa economy and its town providing farmers/landowners better returns, creating meaningful employment opportunities for locals and over-time help support an eco-system of Wairoa-based services that traditionally collect around horticulture. The development of horticulture will utilise the latest technology and incorporate sustainable environmental practices.  §        §Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust seeks a Horticulture Programme Manager for this exciting opportunity of planning, leading, managing and delivering the vision of the Wairoa Horticulture Project. This position will work closely with the Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust Board to finalise the overall horticulture strategy ensuring that outcomes, schedules, relationships and interdependencies are proactively managed. Key responsibilities include facilitating the securing of land for a trial orchard, formalising partnership agreements with commercial partners, stakeholder management, establishing a corporate structure and the development of a training and workforce programme.§        §The successful candidate will be an experienced project manager with a history of successfully delivering projects in a business environment and will ideally have had some exposure to the New Zealand horticulture industry, public sector funding processes and Maori agribusiness. Essential skills required for this position include commercial acumen, strong communication and relationship management skills and financial/budgeting experience along with a dynamic and enthusiastic personality.§        §Don’t miss your opportunity to develop your career and be an integral part of transforming the Wairoa economy and its town; get your application in today!§ §        §To view a Job Information Form or to apply, please visit www.ruraldirections.co.nz or phone the Rural Directions team in confidence on §06 871 0450§ (Reference #2526).§        §Applications close 5pm Monday, 2nd November 2020.§      §      §Please note - only applications through the Rural Directions website www.ruraldirections.co.nz will be considered valid. §    §    §  §§§Recognising Wairoa’s strong land, climate and location advantages and access to readily available water, Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust, Hawkes Bay Regional Council, Ngāti Pāhauwera Development Trust and Wairoa District Council are collaborating to enable the conversion of larger amounts of high-value flat land into horticulture. The development of horticulture will utilise the latest technology and incorporate sustainable environmental practices.  § §Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust seeks a Horticulture Programme Manager for this exciting opportunity of planning, leading, managing and delivering the vision of the Wairoa Horticulture Project. This position will work closely with the Tātau Tātau o Te Wairoa Trust Board to finalise the overall horticulture strategy ensuring that outcomes, schedules, relationships and interdependencies are proactively managed. Key responsibilities include facilitating the securing of land for a trial orchard, formalising partnership agreements with commercial partners, stakeholder management, establishing a corporate structure and the development of a training and workforce programme.§ §The successful candidate will be an experienced project manager with a history of successfully delivering projects in a business environment and will ideally have had some exposure to the New Zealand horticulture industry, public sector funding processes and Maori agribusiness. Essential skills required for this position include commercial acumen, strong communication and relationship management skills and financial/budgeting experience along with a dynamic and enthusiastic personality.§ §Don’t miss your opportunity to develop your career and be an integral part of transforming the Wairoa economy and its town; get your application in today!§ § §To view a Job Information Form or to apply, please visit www.ruraldirections.co.nz or phone the Rural Directions team in confidence on §06 871 0450§ (Reference #2526).§ §Applications close 5pm Monday, 2nd November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50720266.txt	§Ranger, Kaimahi for Nature Support, (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Ranger, Kaimahi for Nature Support, (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§West Coast§, §Rest of West Coast§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Ranger, Kaimahi for Nature Support, (Fixed Term) §        §          §If you love working with others to achieve awesome outcomes for conservation, appreciate a remote natural environment, and have a proven ability for leading and organising work - especially with contractors, then this is the job for you!§          § §          §South Westland Tourism Businesses and communities have been recognised as being some of the most severely impacted by the effects of COVID - with the region being so heavily reliant on international tourism.   TXT for Nature - or Kaimahi for Nature as we call it here - is huge for our District, and we have a Kaimahi for Nature programme that has been funded as a "quick start", which already has 15 Partner Businesses under contract. This role will help set-up, manage and support our Partner Businesses in undertaking valuable conservation work in South Westland.§          §You will need to be able to live and work in a remote rural community and have a positive "can-do" attitude.   Consideration may be given to basing this position in Franz Josef if required.  If this sounds like you - §apply now§!§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §This is a fixed term role for approximately 8 months through until the end of June 2021.§          §Key responsibilities:§          §            §Working with Partner Businesses to determine their Kaimahi for Nature requirements/needs and capabilities and build (through liaising with DOC South Westland staff) a programme of valuable conservation work opportunities to suit§            §Put in place contracts§            §Induct Partner Business staff into the tasks, ensure they have appropriate PPE etc and skills for the role§            §Determine any Partner Business staff training needs - to ensure staff can safely undertake the tasks§            §Audit Partner Business work on tasks in the field - to quality standards, achieving desired outcomes, monitor health and safety standards etc§            §Maintain records of contracts, agreed terms (tasks), inductions, audits etc for South Westland Kaimahi for Nature programme§            §Check and authorise monthly invoices from Partner Businesses for work completed§            §Support South Westland Ranger staff with delivery of Kaimahi for Nature work in the field§            §Support South Westland Kaimahi for Nature media profile with stories, newsletters, social media posts etc.§            §Update and assign new Kaimahi for Nature tasks as required for each partner business.§          §          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §A natural people leader who is passionate about supporting a positive team culture.  We are looking for someone with the confidence and awareness to engage with people from all walks of life. Ideally you will know how to engage effectively in a Māori setting or a willingness to learn karakia, pepeha and local tikanga to develop your capability in this area, allowing you to work effectively with our Treaty Partner.§          §Ideally you will have proven experience in:§          §            §Sensitivity and sound knowledge of Māori culture and the Department's responsibilities to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi under section 4 of the Conservation Act.§            §Great communication skills and the ability to get people on board§            §Excellent planning and organisational skills, with attention to detail and commitment to achieving team objectives§            §Ability to adapt to changing circumstances§            §Strong health and safety focus§            §A current full driving licence§            §A sound understanding of conservation management, strategic and tactical thinking, and planning§          §          §Desired:§          §            §Current First Aid Certificate§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §            §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§            §We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§            §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§            §Excellent development opportunities across the South Westland District and beyond.§          §          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above. §          §For any enquiry, please contact Jackie Hines, §jahines@doc.govt.nz§ or telephone 027 208 5673, §quoting vacancy §400/6620 TEMP. §          §Applications close at 5pm, on Tuesday 27 October 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§          § §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§If you love working with others to achieve awesome outcomes for conservation, appreciate a remote natural environment, and have a proven ability for leading and organising work - especially with contractors, then this is the job for you!§ §South Westland Tourism Businesses and communities have been recognised as being some of the most severely impacted by the effects of COVID - with the region being so heavily reliant on international tourism.   TXT for Nature - or Kaimahi for Nature as we call it here - is huge for our District, and we have a Kaimahi for Nature programme that has been funded as a "quick start", which already has 15 Partner Businesses under contract. This role will help set-up, manage and support our Partner Businesses in undertaking valuable conservation work in South Westland.§You will need to be able to live and work in a remote rural community and have a positive "can-do" attitude.   Consideration may be given to basing this position in Franz Josef if required.  If this sounds like you - §apply now§!§ §§He angitūtanga: About the Role§This is a fixed term role for approximately 8 months through until the end of June 2021.§Key responsibilities:§§Working with Partner Businesses to determine their Kaimahi for Nature requirements/needs and capabilities and build (through liaising with DOC South Westland staff) a programme of valuable conservation work opportunities to suit§Put in place contracts§Induct Partner Business staff into the tasks, ensure they have appropriate PPE etc and skills for the role§Determine any Partner Business staff training needs - to ensure staff can safely undertake the tasks§Audit Partner Business work on tasks in the field - to quality standards, achieving desired outcomes, monitor health and safety standards etc§Maintain records of contracts, agreed terms (tasks), inductions, audits etc for South Westland Kaimahi for Nature programme§Check and authorise monthly invoices from Partner Businesses for work completed§Support South Westland Ranger staff with delivery of Kaimahi for Nature work in the field§Support South Westland Kaimahi for Nature media profile with stories, newsletters, social media posts etc.§Update and assign new Kaimahi for Nature tasks as required for each partner business.§§ §§He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§A natural people leader who is passionate about supporting a positive team culture.  We are looking for someone with the confidence and awareness to engage with people from all walks of life. Ideally you will know how to engage effectively in a Māori setting or a willingness to learn karakia, pepeha and local tikanga to develop your capability in this area, allowing you to work effectively with our Treaty Partner.§Ideally you will have proven experience in:§§Sensitivity and sound knowledge of Māori culture and the Department's responsibilities to the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi under section 4 of the Conservation Act.§Great communication skills and the ability to get people on board§Excellent planning and organisational skills, with attention to detail and commitment to achieving team objectives§Ability to adapt to changing circumstances§Strong health and safety focus§A current full driving licence§A sound understanding of conservation management, strategic and tactical thinking, and planning§§Desired:§§Current First Aid Certificate§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. jobText: TXT/50720574.txt	§Nursery Coordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Nursery Coordinator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced Nursery Coordinator to run the day-to-day operations of the nursery of a certified organic market garden in Rototuna, Hamilton. Our urban market garden produces quality vegetables, greens and microgreens for our established base of customers, using no-dig practices.  It is our intention to work towards biodynamic certification.§The Nursery Coordinator must have demonstrable knowledge and experience in operating an organic nursery (crop and microgreens production), including overseeing the daily operations, supervising staff and retail sale of produce at Farmers Markets. The successful candidate will be reliable, passionate about organics and regenerative agriculture, an enthusiastic self-starter who is willing to work hard to meet the financial, social and environmental objectives of the nursery, and consequently, the market garden. This person will have initiative and be open to sharing their practical skills and experiences with a broad range of people. §Applicants must meet the following criteria:§Level 4 Horticulture certificate or a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience§Demonstrated experience in nursery operations§A working knowledge of organic farming practices§Minimum 1 year of experience in growing micro greens for wholesale and retail§Minimum 1 year of experience in monitoring plant growth and data recording§Computer and administrative skills§Supervisory and leadership skills§Experience in customer service, cash handing and other tasks required in a retail setting§Must live in the area as there will be some early mornings and late nights required§Hours of work: 40 hours per week, flexible hours including weekend work at Farmers Markets.§To apply for this role please email your cover letter highlighting how you meet the requirements for the role, and a copy of your C.V. to whutch024@gmail.com [link removed]. Only applicants shortlisted for interview will be contacted.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50720061.txt	§Expression of Interest - Field Officers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Expression of Interest - Field Officers§§Advertiser: §AsureQuality Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§The Opportunity:§At AsureQuality, we are passionate about biosecurity. We have a highly knowledgeable and experienced team which is currently seeking further opportunities to contribute to a pest-free Aotearoa.§We are currently working on a plan to potentially assist with the eradication of Wilding Conifers, in particular Wilding Pines..§As part of this project, we are seeking interest from enthusiastic and experienced individuals who would be eager to work with us if we were successful in winning this tender.§The work would start around mid-November, and would be based in the wider Otago area.§If the sound of hands-on, physical work in often remote areas sounds like something you want to get into, keep reading!§About you:§We want to hear from you if you§have an Introductory Growsafe Certificate§are experienced and trained in chainsaw use§have experience in identifying and controlling pest plants§are confident driving 4 wheel drives and/or light utility vehicles§are physically fit and self-motivated§enjoy working independently§enjoy and have previously worked in rugged back country or the New Zealand bush§hold a current first aid certificate§A bonus would be if you already hold a National Certificate in Agrichemical Application or you have experience in tree felling.§If the you want to be considered for this exciting opportunity, click on apply now, and we will be in touch.§About us:§Everyday our experienced team of 1800+ people work alongside farmers, producers, and others throughout the food supply chain to help them uphold what Aotearoa stands for in food - a higher standard of quality and safety.§We are passionate about our shared role as Kaitiaki Kai, guardians of food, and have a deep responsibility to do the right thing for food and the environments it comes from.§We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50719791.txt	§Senior Ranger, Community§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Ranger, Community§§Advertiser: §Department of Conservation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Conservation, Parks & Wildlife§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Senior Ranger, Community §        §          §An exciting opportunity has become available for a self-starter within the Tamaki Makaurau/Auckland Mainland team. This full-time, permanent position will lead, guide, support and enable others to help Papatūānuku thrive. We need someone who understands our role as a collaborator, regulator, advocate, storyteller and above all a Treaty partner.§          § §          §He angitūtanga: About the Role§          §The role is based in the heart of New Zealand's biggest city rubbing shoulders with Aotearoa's conservation leaders. If you're passionate about leveraging the amazing opportunities at your fingertips then this is the opportunity for you.§          §As our next Senior Ranger community you will be advising the Operations Manager to plan plan the community conservation work for DOC in Auckland. You will create the vision and work to see it through to completion alongside your colleagues, Treaty Partners and stakeholders.§          § §          §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§          §To be successful in this role you'll need to bring people together, collaborate, prepare effective plans and be accountable for ensuring the plan can be delivered and reported on. You'll be effective, efficient, decisive and have excellent project management skills.§          §Desired§          §            §Skilled in translating strategy and national plans into operational plans§            §Project and budget management experience§            §Able to support aspirations of iwi in a Treaty partnership context engage effectively in Māori settings, willing to learn karakia, pepeha and local tikanga§            §Experience in working with community groups, public and private sector entities§            §Highly collaborative orientation and personal style with negotiating and influencing skills§            §Current full New Zealand driving licence§          §          § §          §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§          §            §A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§            §The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§            §Excellent development opportunities across the Mainland team.§          §          § §          §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§          §Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above.§          §For any enquiry, please contact Kirsty Prior,§kprior@doc.govt.nz§, quoting vacancy 400/9770.§          §Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 2nd November 2020.§ Interviews will be held on 9 November 2020.§          §DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§An exciting opportunity has become available for a self-starter within the Tamaki Makaurau/Auckland Mainland team. This full-time, permanent position will lead, guide, support and enable others to help Papatūānuku thrive. We need someone who understands our role as a collaborator, regulator, advocate, storyteller and above all a Treaty partner.§ §He angitūtanga: About the Role§The role is based in the heart of New Zealand's biggest city rubbing shoulders with Aotearoa's conservation leaders. If you're passionate about leveraging the amazing opportunities at your fingertips then this is the opportunity for you.§As our next Senior Ranger community you will be advising the Operations Manager to plan plan the community conservation work for DOC in Auckland. You will create the vision and work to see it through to completion alongside your colleagues, Treaty Partners and stakeholders.§ §He kōrero mōu: What we are looking for§To be successful in this role you'll need to bring people together, collaborate, prepare effective plans and be accountable for ensuring the plan can be delivered and reported on. You'll be effective, efficient, decisive and have excellent project management skills.§Desired§§Skilled in translating strategy and national plans into operational plans§Project and budget management experience§Able to support aspirations of iwi in a Treaty partnership context engage effectively in Māori settings, willing to learn karakia, pepeha and local tikanga§Experience in working with community groups, public and private sector entities§Highly collaborative orientation and personal style with negotiating and influencing skills§Current full New Zealand driving licence§§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What's in it for you?§§A fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!§The chance to join a large organisation that's still growing. DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives brought into the organisation. This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.§Excellent development opportunities across the Mainland team.§§ §Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory.§Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above.§For any enquiry, please contact Kirsty Prior,§kprior@doc.govt.nz§, quoting vacancy 400/9770.§Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 2nd November 2020.§ Interviews will be held on 9 November 2020.§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50745318.txt	§Vintage Cellar Hands - Blenheim§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Vintage Cellar Hands - Blenheim§§Advertiser: §Constellation Brands New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Winery & Viticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Vintage Cellar Hands - Blenheim §      §        §About Us§Constellation Brands New Zealand is the country’s #1 exporter of wine to the US, with power brands like Kim Crawford dominating in overseas markets. Here at home and in Australia, our innovation continues to hit store shelves with brands like Crafter’s Union, Round Theory, Selaks Taste Collection and The Peoples Wine. Our people and brands are what set us apart from the competition, to carry out our vision of creating brands worth reaching for.§        §About the Role§If you want to be part of 2021 wine history and contribute to award-winning wines, then this is the role for you. Join us in beautiful Marlborough wine country and experience how wine is made! You will be part of an epic team who work closely together to produce some powerhouse brands like Kim Crawford, Crafters Union and Selaks just to name a few. How amazing will it be to pick up a glass of wine that you helped create? You will learn some valuable skills and who knows, you may even decide a career in winemaking is for you. If that’s the case, you’ll get to meet people that could help make this a reality. Estimated start date for Vintage at this location is early March 2021.§        §So, what does the work involve?§        §          §Physical work including machinery operation§          §Approx. 8-12 hour days, 6 days a week (plenty of earning potential)§          §Part of a team all working towards a common goal to produce incredible wine.§        §        §About You§        §          §A team player with a can-do attitude§          §A reasonable level of fitness§          §Health and safety conscious§          §Comfortable with shift work§        §        §Benefits & Culture§        §          §Meal allowance and accommodation support§          §Competitive wage plus ability to earn and bank lots of hours§          §Opportunity and exposure to the wine industry§          §Meet and work with the awesome Constellation team – people from all walks of life and expertise right across winemaking§        §        §Apply now or visit §https://www.constellationnz.com/careers/seasonal-work §for more information§.§        §Constellation Brands is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand. We are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value and encourage participation of all applicants regardless of their background. §        §§      §      §Applications will not be accepted by email. Please click 'Apply for this job' to begin your application.§Visit https://www.constellationnz.com/careers/seasonal-work for more information. §    §    §  §§§About Us§Constellation Brands New Zealand is the country’s #1 exporter of wine to the US, with power brands like Kim Crawford dominating in overseas markets. Here at home and in Australia, our innovation continues to hit store shelves with brands like Crafter’s Union, Round Theory, Selaks Taste Collection and The Peoples Wine. Our people and brands are what set us apart from the competition, to carry out our vision of creating brands worth reaching for.§ §About the Role§If you want to be part of 2021 wine history and contribute to award-winning wines, then this is the role for you. Join us in beautiful Marlborough wine country and experience how wine is made! You will be part of an epic team who work closely together to produce some powerhouse brands like Kim Crawford, Crafters Union and Selaks just to name a few. How amazing will it be to pick up a glass of wine that you helped create? You will learn some valuable skills and who knows, you may even decide a career in winemaking is for you. If that’s the case, you’ll get to meet people that could help make this a reality. Estimated start date for Vintage at this location is early March 2021.§ §So, what does the work involve?§ § §Physical work including machinery operation§ §Approx. 8-12 hour days, 6 days a week (plenty of earning potential)§ §Part of a team all working towards a common goal to produce incredible wine.§ §About You§ § §A team player with a can-do attitude§ §A reasonable level of fitness§ §Health and safety conscious§ §Comfortable with shift work§ §Benefits & Culture§ § §Meal allowance and accommodation support§ §Competitive wage plus ability to earn and bank lots of hours§ §Opportunity and exposure to the wine industry§ §Meet and work with the awesome Constellation team – people from all walks of life and expertise right across winemaking§ §Apply now or visit §https://www.constellationnz.com/careers/seasonal-work §for more information§.§ §Constellation Brands is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand. 5  Campana Rd Wiri between 9am-2pm Mon to Fri or by email, (from Mid October onwards the office is open 7 days).  If you would like an application sent out please email us.  Please ensure you bring your IRD tax number, proof of eligibility to work in New Zealand and photo ID.  Payment can be made to your bank account so it would be preferred if you bring this too.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50745750.txt	§Field Technician (Scanner) §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Field Technician (Scanner) §§Advertiser: §AsureQuality Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§The opportunity:§You will be joining a team that delivers animal health services, market access certification, environmental monitoring, live animal export certification and disease control to the agriculture industry. This role involves undertaking all activities involved in the TB testing contract relating to the scanning of RFID ear tags and adhering to all specifications set by the OSPRI, TBFree and AsureQuality.§The main objective of this role will be assisting Field Technicians perform Scanning on farms around the Eastern Southland and Central Southland regions.§This is a casual role working on an 'as and when' required basis.§About you:§To be successful in this role you will have on farm experience working with large animals, good stock sense, great communication, strong relationship building skills, and be super organised. Computer knowledge - data entry and MS Office is essential. You must have a clean and current full driver's licence, be willing to travel and have the motivation to work unsupervised and contribute to our team environment.§About us:§Everyday our experienced team of 1800+ people work alongside farmers, producers, and others throughout the food supply chain to help them uphold what Aotearoa stands for in food - a higher standard of quality and safety.§We are passionate about our shared role as Kaitiaki Kai, guardians of food, and have a deep responsibility to do the right thing for food and the environments it comes from.§We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You must have a clean and current full driver's licence, be willing to travel and have the motivation to work unsupervised and contribute to our team environment.§About us:§Everyday our experienced team of 1800+ people work alongside farmers, producers, and others throughout the food supply chain to help them uphold what Aotearoa stands for in food - a higher standard of quality and safety.§We are passionate about our shared role as Kaitiaki Kai, guardians of food, and have a deep responsibility to do the right thing for food and the environments it comes from.§We are committed to attracting, developing, and retaining great people, and supporting them to be the best they can be. We know diverse teams are stronger teams and we believe in fairness and opportunity for all.§Helping Aotearoa shape a better food world§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50749693.txt	§Business Development Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Representative§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Other§§§§§§§The Role§ §Halter is a high-growth technology company that has developed technology that enables dairy farmers to physically shift, manage and remotely monitor their herd from anywhere. This  technology will enable farming techniques that have never before been possible. § §With the first handful of customers deployed we are now looking to scale the company. As such we are expanding our Waikato Business Development team and are on the hunt for Business Development Representatives to sell the world's most sophisticated cow movement and monitoring system.§ §As a successful applicant you will be passionate about farming and will enjoy being on farm speaking with dairy farmers. You will thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced working environment and use your initiative to achieve ambitious sales targets. Reporting directly to our Business Development Manager. § §You will be backed by a team of exceptional people at Halter’s HQ and Pilot Farm to ensure this is the best job you’ll ever have.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §Our vision is to unlock the connection between humans and animals to create a better world. This means we convert intentions that humans have into cues that animals understand and actions from animals into insights that humans can understand.§ §Over the last three years we have been on a mission to create guidance control techniques to shift cows remotely using a smart device, removing the need for fences and eliminating the manual nature of shifting animals. Farmers now have incredible new opportunities to unlock efficiency, productivity, and sustainability across all aspects of the farming operation.§ §Our GPS enabled, solar powered devices are designed to remotely guide cows. These require multiple levels of control software in order to record everything about the animal, understand it and act on this information accordingly. We use this to monitor stock health, feed, behaviour and emotion so that farmers can better understand and treat the needs of each animal. We are always pushing to use the latest advancements in technology and want you to be representing this technology. § §We are backed by a set of sophisticated investors that have supported a stream of other leading technology companies including SpaceX, Tesla, AirBNB and Spotify. We are also incredibly fortunate to count Rocket Lab CEO, Peter Beck, as an investor and board member.§ § § §Core Duties§ § § §Screen and qualify incoming leads to assess their fit and priority§ § § §Present Halter’s unique value and benefits to new leads on-farm or to groups§ § § §Clearly communicate functionality and highlight value relative to each farming operation § § § §Build and grow a pipeline of quality farms fit for Halter's product§ § § §Manage and maintain your pipeline, with swift execution of deals§ § § §Maintain relationships with customers by providing support and insight§ § § §Build and leverage industry relationships to establish and maintain Halter's brand§ § § §Provide clear lead progression reports to the Business Development Manager§ § § § §Desired Skills§ § § §At least 3 years experience building and managing customer relationships§ § § §A proven track record closing deals§ § § §Well prepared with strong communication skills§ § § §Exceptional time management skills§ § § §Ambitious and driven§ § § §Dairy farming knowledge strongly preferred § § § §Relevant University degree or equivalent§ § § § §What we can offer you§ § § §A chance to define the future of farming and make the world a better place§ § § §An open and supportive environment where input from all members is encouraged§ § § §The opportunity to work with and grow alongside a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds§ § § §A fast-paced work environment with exposure to world first technology§ § § §Opportunity for rapid development and career progression§ § § §The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology start-up§  § § §If this sounds like you, click apply§ §and submit your CV and cover letter today!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50726808.txt	§Chief Financial Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Financial Officer§§Advertiser: §Only Human - HR Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Puro is on track to become the largest grower of premium medical cannabis in New Zealand.§ §Their two sites in Marlborough have unique microclimates that will enable them to grow the very best products to enhance the lives of those suffering debilitating pain and medical conditions.§ §They have the sites, the buyers, and the partners - they are ready to grow. To help them get there they have raised a significant amount of capital on PledgeMe – setting a new record for crowdfunding in New Zealand.§ §Puro has a unique entrepreneurial culture and prides itself on its employment brand.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Reporting and providing financial leadership, insight and recommendations to the Managing Director, Board and Strategic Advisory Group, the Chief Financial Officer will be accountable for the successful management and administration of the company's finances.§ §This wide-ranging role will be responsible for financial leadership and management as well as risk, compliance, asset and people management.§ §The successful candidate will work closely with the new management team to develop and manage their financial plans and provide valuable data and insights. They will quickly gain an understanding of the wider business and help drive the right decisions for profitability and growth.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §A qualified accounting professional, you will naturally see the big-picture and have the experience and successful track record to commercially back it up. You will ideally have experience in the export sector, with strong risk, auditing, legal and compliance exposure.§ §You will be a multi-tasker with a strong eye for detail, more than capable of preparing accurate, timely and compliant financial accounts.§ §Articulate with a practical can-do attitude, you will be skilled in analysing and producing insightful easy-to-understand financial reports. § §A forward-thinking team player with people management experience, you will show initiative and communicate well forming strong working relationships.§ §------------------------§ §If you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity, please apply using the Seek link now. For further information and a full copy of the Position Description please email Kirsty Trolove at §kirsty@onlyhuman.co.nz§ § § §Applications close by Friday 30 October 2020.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a chief financial officer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50746698.txt	§Lead Veterinarian§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Veterinarian§§Advertiser: §National Veterinary Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead Veterinarian §    §    §      §      §      §Pet Doctors West Harbour§ is located in West Harbour, §Auckland§ and has been part of the local landscape for the last 30 years. The Grower Services Analyst plays a key role in developing and enhancing the information and data our GLM’s use to help our growers.§   § This position is a 9 Month Fixed Term Contract§   § Key Duties & Responsibilities:§   § § §Develop presentations to support the Grower Liaison Team to educate and build relationships with industry stakeholders§ §Providing education to the Grower Services team on grower payments and presentation of industry and grower profitability analysis§ §Analysing data from pre-commercial trials and providing reports and insights§ §Improve tools for publishing information to provide meaningful insights to industry & internally with Zespri teams.§ §Improving data reporting, presentations and analysis by building and complimenting robust data bases§ §Analysis for the Commercial team for general industry issues or targeted projects§ §Provide data, statistics or economic analysis for Government bodies such as MPI, Stats NZ, local council authorities & Environment BOP§ §   § Skills and Experience:§   § § §A relevant qualification ideally in mathematics or business§ §Experience in a similar analytical role supporting a team§ §Advanced understanding of Microsoft Excel and other analytical tools, in-particular data sourcing, manipulation and graphing.§ §Advanced data modelling skills using programs such as Power BI and SQL management studio.§ §Strong analytical and numerical skills.§ §   §   § All applications should be submitted by Friday 30th October§§§§
