jobTitle: Animal Care Attendant Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50773786.txt	§Animal Care Attendant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Animal Care Attendant§§Advertiser: §SPCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Animal Care Attendant §      §        §Contract: §Permanent, Full Time §        §Hours of Work: §Sunday-Thursday, 8.30am-5.00pm§        §Location: §SPCA Whanganui Centre§        §SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. If you are interested in a role where no two days are the same, and the work you do every day makes a difference to the lives of animals in need, we want to hear from you!  §        §We are seeking a Animal Attendant to join our Whanganui team, who can help our centre achieve the best outcomes for the animals under our care. §        §The Animal care Attendant/Volunteer Co-Ordinator is responsible for the day to day care of the animals in the SPCA shelter, including feeding, cleaning, administering medication, monitoring animal health and behaviour, reception duties, dealing with general enquiries, managing adoptions, and supporting volunteers working in the animal areas. From time to time there would be other general duties around the Centre, so a ‘can do’ attitude would be great. §        §Our ideal candidate will: §        §· Have at least 3 years proven experience working within an animal care role i.e vet clinic, boarding kennels/cattery, SPCA centre§        §· Have excellent communication and customer service skills, with the ability to handle conflict situations and a friendly and positive attitude. §        §· Be a self-motivated team player, who is enthusiastic and passionate about animal welfare. §        §· Have practical animal-handling experience and knowledge. §        §· Have a flexible approach to the hours of work, and be able to prioritise and effectively manage workloads. §        §· Have excellent computer skills. §        §· Demonstrate empathy and resilience §        §· Have the ability to work in a fast paced environment and must have a love for working with both people and animals. §        §. Live in the Whanganui region.§        §· Have a clean full drivers license and ability to drive a manual vehicle.§        §A qualification in Vet nursing would be advantageous. §        §Are you committed to the values of the SPCA? Does this sound like the ideal role for you? Please apply now with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how your skills match the criteria.  Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. §        §Applications close on Thursday 29th October 2020.§        §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Job-Description-Animal-Attendant.docx§      §      §      §    §  §§§Contract: §Permanent, Full Time §Hours of Work: §Sunday-Thursday, 8.30am-5.00pm§Location: §SPCA Whanganui Centre§SPCA is one of the best loved and most respected charities in New Zealand, with a proud history of helping animals in need and advocating for animal welfare since 1872. If you are interested in a role where no two days are the same, and the work you do every day makes a difference to the lives of animals in need, we want to hear from you!  §We are seeking a Animal Attendant to join our Whanganui team, who can help our centre achieve the best outcomes for the animals under our care. §The Animal care Attendant/Volunteer Co-Ordinator is responsible for the day to day care of the animals in the SPCA shelter, including feeding, cleaning, administering medication, monitoring animal health and behaviour, reception duties, dealing with general enquiries, managing adoptions, and supporting volunteers working in the animal areas. From time to time there would be other general duties around the Centre, so a ‘can do’ attitude would be great. §Our ideal candidate will: §· Have at least 3 years proven experience working within an animal care role i.e vet clinic, boarding kennels/cattery, SPCA centre§· Have excellent communication and customer service skills, with the ability to handle conflict situations and a friendly and positive attitude. §· Be a self-motivated team player, who is enthusiastic and passionate about animal welfare. §· Have practical animal-handling experience and knowledge. §· Have a flexible approach to the hours of work, and be able to prioritise and effectively manage workloads. §· Have excellent computer skills. §· Demonstrate empathy and resilience §· Have the ability to work in a fast paced environment and must have a love for working with both people and animals. §. Live in the Whanganui region.§· Have a clean full drivers license and ability to drive a manual vehicle.§A qualification in Vet nursing would be advantageous. §Are you committed to the values of the SPCA? Does this sound like the ideal role for you? Please apply now with your CV and cover letter outlining your interest in the role and how your skills match the criteria.  Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. §Applications close on Thursday 29th October 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §Job-Description-Animal-Attendant.docx§§§§

jobTitle: Business Analyst Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50774251.txt	§Business Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Analyst§§Advertiser: §Pāmu§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Farm Management§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §    §      §Business Analyst §      §        §          §Large agricultural business§          §Newly established role§        §        §Do you want to use your financial and business analytical skills in an evolving multimillion dollar agribusiness?§        §          §Are you comfortable facilitating discussions, identifying opportunities for efficiency, and working on projects to implement improvements?§          §Contribute to positive changes for NZ and the world - Business Analyst - Taupo§        §        §Do you want to make a real impact and contribute to the transformation of an iconic multi-million dollar NZ agribusiness? Are you known as a research ninja? Do you have mad excel skills? Have you got a commerce or finance background and an appetite for learning? Would you like to be in a work environment where your input is sought after and valued?§        §The dairy industry is changing and we're looking for a Business Analyst who can help us as we take a leadership role in tackling critical farming issues. We're working to achieve better water quality, lower greenhouse gases, and produce higher-value sustainable food and fibre products for kiwis and the world. There's a huge variety of work and plenty of scope for you to follow your interests and develop your strengths. If you're smart, proactive, curious, and keen to make an impact, this role's for you.§        §Having a background in agriculture would be great but we also want you to have the confidence to ask questions, tackle new subject matters, and use your critical thinking skills to suggest and follow through on strategies for developing efficiencies. Being able to engage with all levels of stakeholders will be the cornerstone of your success in this role. You'll develop relationships with and work across every team in our business which means you'll be learning from some of the sharpest minds in NZ agribusiness.§        §You'll facilitate conversations, provide your analytical insight to complex problems, help transition our agribusiness to a land use company. We're looking at innovative ways to use the land that will have the least environmental impact whilst still creating value. We're committed to our people and to our animals and you'll be in the unique position to participate at the forefront of these decisions and changes.§        §We'll provide you with a supportive team and tons of growth opportunities here in Wellington or nationwide if you'd like. You'll receive a comprehensive remuneration that includes a great salary and benefits such as health insurance, 4% matching superannuation contribution, and more.§        §Applications for this role will close on Sunday, 1 November 2020. If you have any questions or for a confidential discussion, please email Cleo Te Kiri at §tekiric@landcorp.co.nz§Click here to view the role description§      §      §      §    §    §    §      §        §          §            §BROUGHT TO YOU BY §LAND§CORP§            §pamu.co.nz§          §        §      §    §  §§§Large agricultural business§Newly established role§Do you want to use your financial and business analytical skills in an evolving multimillion dollar agribusiness?§Are you comfortable facilitating discussions, identifying opportunities for efficiency, and working on projects to implement improvements?§Contribute to positive changes for NZ and the world - Business Analyst - Taupo§Do you want to make a real impact and contribute to the transformation of an iconic multi-million dollar NZ agribusiness? Are you known as a research ninja? Do you have mad excel skills? Have you got a commerce or finance background and an appetite for learning? Would you like to be in a work environment where your input is sought after and valued?§The dairy industry is changing and we're looking for a Business Analyst who can help us as we take a leadership role in tackling critical farming issues. We're working to achieve better water quality, lower greenhouse gases, and produce higher-value sustainable food and fibre products for kiwis and the world. There's a huge variety of work and plenty of scope for you to follow your interests and develop your strengths. If you're smart, proactive, curious, and keen to make an impact, this role's for you.§Having a background in agriculture would be great but we also want you to have the confidence to ask questions, tackle new subject matters, and use your critical thinking skills to suggest and follow through on strategies for developing efficiencies. Being able to engage with all levels of stakeholders will be the cornerstone of your success in this role. You'll develop relationships with and work across every team in our business which means you'll be learning from some of the sharpest minds in NZ agribusiness.§You'll facilitate conversations, provide your analytical insight to complex problems, help transition our agribusiness to a land use company. We're looking at innovative ways to use the land that will have the least environmental impact whilst still creating value. We're committed to our people and to our animals and you'll be in the unique position to participate at the forefront of these decisions and changes.§We'll provide you with a supportive team and tons of growth opportunities here in Wellington or nationwide if you'd like. You'll receive a comprehensive remuneration that includes a great salary and benefits such as health insurance, 4% matching superannuation contribution, and more.§Applications for this role will close on Sunday, 1 November 2020. jobText: TXT/50775432.txt	§Team Leader - Horticulture§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leader - Horticulture§§Advertiser: §People Plus§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§Four Seasons Packhouse is located on the vibrant East Coast providing a variety of quality services to support growers with the packing, marketing, and distribution of squash and citrus worldwide. Due to diversification and growth of the business, Four Seasons are seeking an experienced Team Leader to help drive the team to reach maximum performance.§ §The Team Leader is an integral role in the business and will be responsible for leading teams in the field and packhouse. The horticulture industry is dependent on quality and customer satisfaction, and the Team Leader will work alongside the Packhouse and Kiwifruit Division Managers and Operations Manager to make sure a quality product /service is provided every time.§ §To be considered for this role there are must have qualifications, knowledge and experience.§ §Must haves of the Team Leader:§ § §Tertiary qualification in horticulture, agriculture or similar§ §Previous experience driving a Harvester§ §Previous experience working in Horticulture and leading a team§ §Previous experience operating machinery and trucks§ §Valid NZ Drivers Licenses, including heavy vehicle licenses§ §Working knowledge of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015§ §Commitment to the health and wellbeing of team members§ §Excellent time and attendance§ §If you think you meet the criteria of the role and have what it takes to add value to Four Seasons Packhouse, then apply now! Applications will be managed by People Plus on behalf of Four Seasons Packhouse, for any questions and enquires please send these via email to §admin@peopleplus.co.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50773743.txt	§Liaison Arborist (Utility) - Manawatu§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Liaison Arborist (Utility) - Manawatu§§Advertiser: §Asplundh§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Horticulture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Liaison Arborist (Utility) - Manawatu §    §    §      §        §          §            §We are seeking a Liaison Utility Arborist to work on a significantly important Utility Contract based in Fielding. The role focuses on liaising and communicating with tree owners with the intent of gaining approval to deliver scoped works. The successful candidate must have excellent, personable communication skills and be a real people person who loves contributing to a growing, successful team.§            §Duties include:§            §              §Liaising directly with tree owners and gaining authorisation to carry out contract works§              §Liaise with crews tasked to complete works and undertake pre job briefings when required§              §Auditing of on site works to ensure quality performance targets are achieved§              §Tracking revenue and achieving financial targets§              §Reporting on overall performance in a transparent, clear format§            §            §Asplundh offers you a safe working environment, with training and advancement opportunities.§            §To be successful in this role ideally you will:§            §              §Have excellent communication skills, required to liaise with tree owners to sign up work§              §Proven experience in planning works and communicating with key stakeholders§              §Experience in using Excel and Word§              §Be a qualified and experienced arborist, however this is not compulsory§            §            §We are an alcohol, drug and smoke free company who hold safety as our key priority. Successful applicants are required to pass a pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol test as well as a Ministry of Justice police check.§          §          §          §        §      §    §    §Contact us now to talk§ about your remuneration§ expectation and career direction!§    §  §§§We are seeking a Liaison Utility Arborist to work on a significantly important Utility Contract based in Fielding. The role focuses on liaising and communicating with tree owners with the intent of gaining approval to deliver scoped works. The successful candidate must have excellent, personable communication skills and be a real people person who loves contributing to a growing, successful team.§ §Duties include:§ § §Liaising directly with tree owners and gaining authorisation to carry out contract works§ §Liaise with crews tasked to complete works and undertake pre job briefings when required§ §Auditing of on site works to ensure quality performance targets are achieved§ §Tracking revenue and achieving financial targets§ §Reporting on overall performance in a transparent, clear format§ §Asplundh offers you a safe working environment, with training and advancement opportunities.§ §To be successful in this role ideally you will:§ § §Have excellent communication skills, required to liaise with tree owners to sign up work§ §Proven experience in planning works and communicating with key stakeholders§ §Experience in using Excel and Word§ §Be a qualified and experienced arborist, however this is not compulsory§ §We are an alcohol, drug and smoke free company who hold safety as our key priority. Successful applicants are required to pass a pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol test as well as a Ministry of Justice police check.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§§§

jobTitle: Seafood Process Worker - Christchurch Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50778330.txt	§Seafood Process Worker - Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seafood Process Worker - Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Ngāi Tahu Holdings Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Farming, Animals & Conservation§, §Fishing & Aquaculture§§§§§§Kia hiwa rā!§ §Ngāi Tahu Seafood is looking for a Seafood Process Worker who is keen to learn new skills and to be involved in the process of receiving, grading, swimming, checking and packing out our high value live lobster to export and local market customers. Reliability is a must as the team depend on each other to get the job done to meet the market demands.§ §As a Seafood Process Worker, you will need to be flexible as we will offer shift work hours that may be early morning, afternoon, and weekend hours, on an as and when required basis.  A Heavy Trade and/or Forklift driver licence would be an advantage.§ §If interested please apply by clicking on the link and we will be in touch.§ §Nau mai, haere mai, tauti mai!§§§§
